Posted: June 6, 2014
												TL;DR - This game is not worth any money at all, and I am glad I got it the day it was free. If you want a more realistic shooter, buy any of the terribly inaccurate Call of Duty series. That's how bad this game is. This game is an embarassment to any "sniping" game. You can NOT change shoulders at all which in a third person shooter is extremely frustrating and will kill your more than anything else in the game. The cover system is complete and total sh** by not letting you peek out to shoot whenever it wants to, and the fact that you have to FULLY EXPOSE yourself to make a shot. Secondly this game demands you either make a headshot or shoot something vital i.e the heart or lungs in order to kill someone in the multiplayer which is total sh** again because WWII had little to no body armor at all (Yes there was body armor in WWII that's when it started being made i.e flak jackets). The ballistics on the weapons are very poor; in the multiplayer I shot someone five times in the inside of the thigh, groin, and pelvis with a 1911. I have fired a 1911 and .45's tend to put people on their butt really easily. And seeing as the femoral artery is in the inner thigh and pretty easy to hit, that guy should have died. Instead he pulled his sidearm and shot me in the face once and continued to run around unhindered. Another thing is that your rifle bullets will ALWAYS over penetrate in the campaign. BULLETS DO NOT DO THIS! Especially the rifles used in WWII, not every shot would over penetrate. The last thing that really annoyed me was how the game sends you alone with no spotter or back up. Sorry, snipers never work alone. That is a HUGE pet peeve of mine with most shooting games: they all think snipers are lone wolf bamf's who can do reach into their pack, pull on their Super Man cape and save the day. That and the fact that you can soak up any round type in the campaign and be perfectly fine after hiding in cover for a few seconds makes this game completely and totally worthless.

Posted: February 19
												Visually a great game, but besides the initial fun of setting up the shot and seeing the bullet cam the fun kind of drops off. It gets repetitive and in some cases makes the game hard to play as a sniper. You get in to close quarter fights that you can only really survive by pulling out the pistol or machine gun to complete. And it amazes me that every single enemy in the area instantly knows exactly where you are once you fire a shot. In an urban setting with buildings, streets and walls, the sounds of gunfire would echo and be pretty difficult to pinpoint.Straight up: this is not a tactical game about sniping, and definitely not realistic. If you want a very arcade-like shooter then maybe go for it based on its one big draw: slow-mo bullet cam. I have played the game for hours just for this feature, but once it wears off you are left with flawed and rough game mechanics and plot. Plot is bad, but not critically so, I've seen worse. The gameplay features firefights mainly at under 200m with very unrealistic features (such as shooting through corners due to bullet tracing form the crosshair rather than the gun, and using 3rd person to peek and scout the area). The actual situations it places you in as a sniper are also poorly chosen, as most snipers excel in situations of patience, strategy and long-range targets. Forget all of that; it is very linear and confined, and you have will be just as good firing quick snapshots between sprints as you would if you crawled to a good spot, steadied your heartbeat, controlled your breathing and took a good shot. Additionally you just shrug off bullets call of duty style.

content:
Posted: November 3, 2013
												Sniper Elite V2 is one of those games that's hit-or-miss (pun semi-intended).  I only just got the PC version, but I've had the Xbox 360 version for close to a year now and the only difference I can see is the graphics quality.  In fact, let's start with that, shall we?The graphics of Sniper Elite V2 are surprisingly excellent.  The game world itself is far from beautiful, but that is to be expected when you're a lone wolf sniper crawling through the rubble of Berlin in the twilight hours of the Second World War.  The amount of detail is extraordinary.  You can see the leathery texture of an SS officer's jacket just as you're about to blow his brains out.  My only concern is, perhaps, optimization.  Could have used a bit more, but nothing too serious.The storyline is nothing to write home about, but it gets the job done of linking the missions together.A lot of the time you'll be crawling around in the ruined streets of Berlin, but you do get to see a few other environments.  Each of the levels is quite linear.  To a lot of players, this is what breaks the game, and I can understand that.  However if  you can get past the linearity it is still a very enjoyable experience.As for the gameplay, well, it's a sniper game.  You get a sniper rifle, a pistol, and an SMG, along with various booby traps.  The star of the show truly is your rifle.  This should be your go-to weapon throughout most of the game.  The sniper mechanics in this game are phenomenal, and highly customizable.  Bad shot?  You can set it so that bullets come right out of CoD and hit where you're aiming.  Just got off of a BF gaming binge?  You can set it so that bullets are effected by gravity.  Really want to challenge yourself?  You can set it so that not only is there bullet drop, but also wind as well.  On top of this, you will always have to watch your heartrate.  If you're running around a lot, your heart rate is going to spike and your scope will sway heavily.  Stay low, move slowly, and take your time and your heart rate will drop and you can focus on the shot or even slow time.Once you take that shot, it is very likely that you will go into a bullet cam, which will often show an X-ray view of your target as their organs are shredded by your sniper shot.  You can control the frequency of these bullet cams if you're squeamish or just don't like much gore, but I do not believe you can completely turn them off.  It is, however, quite satisfying when you see your round enter through an enemy's skull, exit out the other side, tumble realistically through the air, and proceed to take out his buddy behind him.That AI themselves are quite varied between the difficulty levels.  Easy AI will have them walking in circles, wondering where the sniper is that just dropped their friend while you proceed to plink away at their ranks.  Hard AI means that one wrong shot will result in your death.  Medium AI is comfortably in between the two.Finally, the co-op and multiplayer...  I admit that I have not tried to competitive multiplayer yet, but I did take a quick glance at the options and servers.  There are quite a few servers running and the options for a custom match are outrageous.  As for co-op, you can team up with a shooting buddy and take on either a challenge mission or a wave-based survival mode.  I can say that both of these are extremely fun and, in some ways, make up for the singleplayers linearity with open maps that allow you to roost in whatever sniper perch you find suitable.All-in-all, I'd say that Sniper Elite V2 is not a game that I would pay a full $60 USD for.  At the current price of $30 USD, however, it is a great game, so long as you're interested.  If you're looking for a game that has basic, yet functioning, stealth mechanics, fun cooperative play, and excellent sniping mechanics, then I suggest you pick up Sniper Elite V2.  It's not the end-all-be-all of sniper games, but it's a hell of a lot better than Sniper: Ghost Warrior.  I can tell you that much!

Posted: June 26, 2014
												Fresh from completing Sniper Elive V2, I thought I'd give a brief couple of points on the game.Positives:+WWII setting.  Differentiates itself from the current 'modern' trend.  Appreciate WWII was the big thing 5-10 years ago.+Graphics.  Decent graphics, some nice effects like fire and explosions that look good without too much scrutiny.+Physics.  Completed on Sniper Elite difficulty so got to experience some decent bullet drop balistics etc.  Shots are definitely missable if you're not careful.+X-Ray Kill Cam.  This just never gets old.  Ever.  There's something immensely satisfying seeing the skeleton of your enemy shatter into little bits.+Campaign length.  Though it could be completed quicker (I'm sure), I got a good 10+ hours out of the single player.Negatives:-A.I.  Far too easy.  The game can effectively be progressed by simply giving your position away, letting the A.I. run around in the open as they try to hit you.  Makes sniping actually a little too easy.-Opernplatz.  There's a progression bug on this map. I hit it, couldn't get past and ended up shelving the game for 6-12 months.  Thankfully, a fresh download seemed to let me move on when I finally returned.  Very disappointing.-Story.  Generic America saves the world (well, America saves London in this instance).  Not very exciting and a little too Hollywood.-Linearity.  Maps can be moved across using various routes but it's essentially a point A to point B fare.  Shame really. -Kit too situational.  I had mines, trip mines, dynamite, grenades and a rock (no, NOT  Dwayne Johnson) but using them was VERY situational.  Had the game given me better A.I. (i.e. supressing and flanking etc.) then maybe I'd have used a more tactical approach such as trip mining doorways and the like - but the game just doesn't need it.  You can treat it like any other shooter and progress just fine.  A massively missed opportunity. Overall, I'd definitely say I had fun with Sniper Elite V2 (taking aside Opernplatz) and would recommend it as being 'worth playing'.  Arguably one of the better sniping games in recent years.Lastly, it's really cheeky of Rebellion to peddle DLC and the next game on the exit screen.  Bad form, folks.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												Sniper Elite V2 is a 3rd Person Shooter with the 2nd World War as the setting.___________________________________________________++Story++You are a (correct me if I am wrong) nameless sharpshooter who was sent to Berlin to kill important germans. On your way, you find out that the nazis have a last ace, the V2 Missiles, brutal weapons of mass destruction that are aimed at London, and you make it to your mission to destroy the V2s and defeat the Nazis.++Gameplay++The game has the typical shooter corridor as the leveldesign: Take way A, B, or C, but in the end, all ways lead to the same destination. But what is different? You can sneak completely unseen past the enemies, or kill them all with your sniper rifle. Loud noises can drown the noise of your rifle, so you can shoot without warning the enemy. If you just shoot the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of everything, you will alert the enemy and get quickly killed, which is positive because snipers are not supposed to take a lot of damage. You have some tools like mines and grenades to prevent soldiers from following you or flanking you. If you take out an enemy with the sniper rifle, you will most likely trigger a bullet cam that shows precisely how your bullet penetrates the body of your target, which can look disgusting at times because you see in X-Ray how the bones and organs get damaged (looks very amazing when you shoot your enemy's eye).++Grafics++The grafics are the usual standart for shooters back in 2012. Not amazingly good, but not bad either. The faces have  animations, the bullet cam looks great.++Music++The music gets annoying fast and is brutally loud, so turn it a little bit down before you start playing. Better play with some own music.++Features++Your sniper bullets are actually influenced by gravity and wind if you do not play on easy, which is amazing and makes the shooting harder, and requires you to think a little bit when you shoot.___________________________________________________I thought that this game is like Sniper Ghost Warrior a hidden CoD clone, but it is a solid 3rd Person shooter with innovation and ideas, and that makes this game worth to be bought. Good work, Rebellion!

content:
Posted: January 6, 2013
												Modern shooter design has evolved such that the headshot is the most desired action. Game after game, we are conditioned to aim for the head  thanks to the unique animations and sounds that result. But in this game, headshots are just the beginning.On the surface, Sniper Elite V2 seems like yet another brown WW2 shooter. Every level is "bombed out European city" and you're America's answer to Golgo 13, casually blowing up tanks, trucks, and rockets with well-placed rifle fire. But the kill cam makes all the difference. With most killshots, you get a dramatic slow motion shot of the bullet traveling and killing its target. An X-Ray shot lets you see exactly which bones and vital organs are obliterated. Now, you've incentive to aim not just for the brain, but the heart. The lungs. The testes. THIS NEVER GETS OLD. EVER.You can adjust enemy AI and ballistic modeling to suit your tastes. Don't want the videogame-y HUD assistance? Turn it off. Want to have to adjust aim for distance? How about wind? The option's there. You can sneak if you want too, being mindful of sound and enemy line of sight as you hide bodies, cause distractions, and use a crappy silenced pistol. But there is zero penalty for neglecting to use stealth, and eventually you HAVE to fight. By all means, go...ballistic. This isn't Hitman. You have to get spotted. That's why you can and should set traps for when the Nazis and the Reds come a-runnin'. You can't set off your own mines, but you can get hurt when they do explode.The fact that you're given points for each kill encourages you to just shoot everybody you see. Incapacitate a guy in the open to draw his friends out to save him. Then put one shot through both of them. BONUS POINTS. You actually get the fewest points for sneaking up behind someone and melee killing them. Co-op play is supported through the entire campaign (albeit with fewer X-Ray shots), and there's special co-op multiplayer as well. Versus multiplayer...eh, it's a game about camping and sniping. Don't bother with that.The Metacritic score is wrong. The reviewers are wrong. This game is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ed TRIUMPH, and every level is highly replayable. The DLC's pretty good too, especially its infamous "Kill Hitler" mission. No co-op on those, sadly.

												Even if I'm not the greatest sniper, I still love sniping and sniping games! Sniper Elite V2 was a fun little treat to play, quite enjoyable. It's third-person as you move around but you'll find yourself looking through your scope most of the time. It looks pretty decent, I noticed a few glitches here and there but nothing major nor anything game breaking. The game doesn't have the most interesting story but it holds up good enough. This is a game that's all about the game play which makes it understandable that the story is lacking a bit.You're an awesome sniper and you're job is to be sneaky and snipe your way through German and/or Russian soldiers while getting to your objectives. The sneaky part is harder than it sounds. The sniping rifles are the main characters in this game, the rest of the guns are not quite as powerful but they do the trick, if you aim right. There are a lot of things to take into account to make the perfect shot count.The use of sound is quite important in this game, you sometimes will see an indicator on your top-right when a large sound can mask your shots. Trying to time this right was pretty fun, since if your shots are heard the enemy might notice your position rather fast. The AI isn't perfect, I found them running into obstacles and getting stuck once in a while, which was pretty funny but takes away a little of the challenge. I had a lot fun with the game though and I recommend it, it's about 8-9 hours long. The game also has a co-op mode that can add a few extra hours.

												The following is based mostly on single player campaign at the highest difficulty.Supercommando Elite Sniper Elite V2 sounds like an ideal sequel: bigger, prettier and more polished. Unfortunately it flushes a good basic sniping mechanic complemented by a delightful x-ray death animation system down the drain with horrendous design decisions like scripted enemies teleporting out of nowhere and lack of manual saving. Better place your bets on the sequels.+Graphics have aged pretty well and the game seems mostly well optimized. Lack of borderless window support is a pain though+On a decent SSD at least there are almost no loading times except when starting the game+In terms of production quality sounds and music are fine work+Depicts war torn areas reasonably well in the game's own limited context+Good sniping mechanics+X-ray killshots remain entertaining throughout the campaign-No manual saving. Did I say no manual saving? There is no manual saving-Only one checkpoint "save slot" that is used badly and far too sparsely. The game has no qualms about saving in the middle of a fight which may force you to restart a whole mission-Scripted enemy spawning out of nowhere. This is a running theme throughout the game that becomes predictable after a few missions.-Forced combat: no matter how stealthily you manage to get through one phase of a mission, the game can still throw a bunch of enemies in your face fully aware of your location-The game is very linear with usually only one path to follow in any area which doesn't really fit with the whole sniper theme, Then again the whole gameplay feels more suited for some kind of commando or saboteur game rather than a sniper game-Sniper duels are boring. As enemy snipers can spawn out of nowhere you tend to detect them by getting hit first. Then you wait for a moment to heal and try to return fire. Rinse and repeat-In some missions enemy snipers are utterly infallible and will shoot you with perfect accuracy and no detection or preparation lag of any kind, leading to very tedious gameplay-The player's weapon accuracy is laughably bad while enemies can hit you almost always no matter the distance or weapon. The silenced pistol is particularily inaccurate even at almost point blank range.-Hit detection is appalling at times. I lost count how many times I saw a bullet shot at someones face impact on a wall behind them instead-Absurd stealth mechanics. You either move soundlessly in a crouch (except when falling even a few centimeters, that makes huge noise) or then you run like a rampaging elephant which the enemies can easily hear. Oddly the enemies themselves hardly ever make any footstep sounds...-Some inexplicable framerate drops in simple cutscenes

												Sniper Elite V2Story - Interesting, full of action, has awesome moments! 9/10Storyline Length - Should take you a couple hours. It isn't that long of a game.AI - Quite stupid on easier difficulties, but on Sniper Elite difficulty, they will hunt you down. They'll use grenades, be accurate with their bullets, even try to surround you. 8/10Experience - Singleplayer campaign is cool, you can replay it a couple times and still not get bored, the coop is brilliant, but the multiplayer can go burn in hell. Honestly, I expected a stealthy game where you get in, do the objective, get out. But NOOOOOOoooooOOOOOO, you can't finish an entire mission in stealth. Still pretty awesome! 8.5/10Graphics - Quite realistic, there's a lot of detail in nearly everything on high graphics. 9/10Sounds / Voice Acting - Gunshots, explosions, Nazis shouting at you to "Show yourself, dog!", reloading sounds, it's all just really beautiful. 10/10Controls - Easy to learn, a bit too easy to learn. Great tutorial, I'd say! 10/10Overall - 9/10It's a fun WW2 Sniper game, you've got enemies around every corner, you've got targets to kill (obviously), you've got♥♥♥♥♥♥to explode, you've got the absolute awesome experience of being a sniper. If you haven't played this game, then atleast try out the demo. It's super fun! Forgot to mention, when you get a vital shot on an enemy, it shows you this X-Ray killcam, a bit like Mortal Kombat's X-Ray thingy. I'm not a psychopath but this is the only reason why I have 222 hours in this game.(The DLC is cool too, you get to kill Hitler >:3 )

content:
Posted: July 11, 2013
												I didn't expect to have as much fun as i did with this one. The game starts off pretty weak with the regenerating health system being the main flaw that i could spot instantly. This coupled with enemy placement in the early stages makes the game feel too easy even on the highest difficulty setting as there is little to no consequnce if you get shot. In turn this enables you to be pretty reckless using the crosshair or "quickscoping" to take down targets in one shot even from point blank distance, neutralizing the need for a sidearm in CQC engagements.Later on, however, the pace picks up and the stakes get high as there are more enemies arround and you'll have to plan your shots accordingly lest you want to be dead within seconds. Another feature that plays an important role later on but is sadly downplayed on the earlier levels due to the reasons mentioned above, is "masking" your shots using ambient noise to avoid being detected by the enemy.As the game progresses engagements and scenarios become more memorable with a certain fire fight on the rooftops of war-torn and ravaged Berlin being an incredible experience.The game's trademark feature (or gimmick) is the gruesome killcam that resembles MK9's X-ray moves. Personally i love it but there is the option to reduce its frequency if you want to.The game's story is forgetable and it's there only as a reason for you to snipe some dudes.On a technical level the game looks and performs great and there are lots of options in the menu to customize your experience. A benchmark is also included.What stood out for me though in the technical aspect was, inspite of the levels being pretty big and beautiful, the load times were incredibly short and almost zero on my dated sata2 7200.11 drive.As far as multiplayer is concerned there is a slew of co-op missions and 3 different modes as well as vs with a server browser. From what i got to play the netcode was good and the vs part was surprisingly active and fast for a sniper game as you could tag opponents for your teammates to see, effectively countering camping to a degree and preventing the game from becoming a total snoozefest.Recommended.

												This game is fun at first, but it gets very repetitive by the time you're halfway through.It would be more accurate to call this a stealth game than a sniper game, though chances are most of the time you'll get discovered and it'll be a straight up shoot-out anyway. The game flies in the face of game logic that bringing a sniper rifle to a firefight means insta-death for you, with it expecting you to use the rifle in close-quarters combat, as the regular machine guns are the useless weapons this time round.What you're left with is basically a shoot-em-up, going from point A to B, and repeat, plowing through firefights as you go. You might be expecting some sort of sniper simulator, but even in this game you're a super soldier single-handedly winning the war by wading into battlegrounds, walking up to enemies and shooting them no problem. On harder difficulties it instead turns to frustration as you have to restart the entire part several times because of a hidden sniper taking you out when the coast was supposedly clear.With no variation, it gets boring fast, if not infuriating.A Steam game review without any forced jokes. Posted: June 22, 2014
												I got this game for free during a promotion recently, so I really didn't have anything to lose by trying it. But having played it for several hours now, I'm glad to say I'd have paid full price for it (and I'm very likely to buy V3). The sniping mechanics are extremely satisfying, the visuals are crisp, and the gameplay can be frantic at times.There are a few minor problems. The AI is very hit-or-miss. Sometimes they'll loop around and flank you before you realize what's happening, while other times they get stuck against a tree or other object and make themselves an extremely easy target. Additionally, stealth kills are problematic. If you hit the indicated button when behind an enemy to perform a quick takedown, it usually doesn't work if the enemy is seated. Likewise, you can't perform this technique from any angle other than directly behind the guard, which frustrated me when I would tap the button while slightly diagonal to the guard only to have nothing happen.Aside from those gripes though, it's a very satisfying game and a nice (dare I say much-needed) return to the WWII setting. A++ would play again.

content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
												I'm not really a fan of shooters that are based off of historic wars. War stories typically don't intrigue me and I usually find them to be repetitive and dull, which means games like this need to have superb gameplay in order for me to enjoy it. Fortunately, Sniper Elite V2's gameplay delivers.Story:The game takes place in Berlin. It's 1945 and nearing the end of World War II. The Americans are gathering the best of Germany's rocket scientists and V2 programme architects for Operation Overcast. You assume the role of Karl Fairburne, an american sniper sent out to make sure those scientists don't end up in Russia's hands.Gameplay:Unlike other modern day shooters, Sniper Elite V2 doesn't focus so much on going in guns blazing. Instead, it focuses on stealth and strategically timing your shots in order to complete your mission unnoticed and unharmed. As you can probably tell by the title, this is a sniping game. It's largely focused on sniping your enemies from distances while staying in cover. Sniping out enemies with your rifle is so satisfying thanks to the x-ray effect. When you pull the trigger, a short slow-motion cinematic shot will begin showing the bullet penetrate your enemy. For example, if you shoot your enemy through the eye, it'll show the bullet penetrating the eye and coming out of the back of the skull. Even after doing this for hours, it never gets old. You're always trying to get that next great headshot. However, it's not all about sniping. There will be times when an enemy soldier will be alerted by the sound of your rifle and you'll have to defend yourself in other ways. The game allows you to carry three weapons at a time. This usually consists of one rifle, one pistol and one machine gun. The game also allows you to carry various equipment such as trip wires, land mines, dynamite and even rocks to distract your enemies. With so many options, the gameplay definitely makes up for it's lack of interesting storytelling.The game also has different collectibles to pick up throughout each level if you care about that sort of thing, but it's up to the player and isn't necessary in order to complete the game. It's a nice additional feature that encourages the player to explore every corner of the map. Conclusion:If you're a fan of third-person shooters, stealth games, or if you just love sniping, I'd definitely check this out. I'd also recommend getting the DLC packs for this game as they contain extra missions and weapons. I can't say the additional weapons are worth it because I didn't find myself using them that often. However, the four additional missions should add on a few more hours of fun if the base game left you craving more.

												This is a beautiful game I must say! The game's genre should be really action/stealth because I find that the majority of the time you are out to snipe people's head from range and still remain hidden. This is actually crucial if you are playing this on harder difficulty, but I just played it on normal difficulty and still found that being stealthy and doing stealth kills is a plus rather than go charging and spraying.What I didn't like so far was the fact that there were no *silenced* sniper rifles, or at least an option to add a silence to it. Because I prefer that all my shots from out of line of sight be quiet shots rather than me kill one person and then a battalion of troops somehow find out where I am camping and start blasting my area!But I suppose back in the day - there weren't really any silenced sniper rifles, were there? If that were the case in this game is trying to be as close as possible to what it was like back in the WW2 days with what weapons and arms existed at the time, ok fair enough I won't argue with that; however, if not - I do wish there was some sort of silencer for the rifles. Though if this is really an *action* intended game rather than stealth/action, ok I can understand them not adding a attachable/detachable silencer of sorts to any gun.Yes there is a silenced pistol I use to do stealth kills, but that won't get a target that's 1km away from where you stand/crouch/prone!But that's it, everything else is perfectly fine!What's next is to find some people that I can do co-op mode with throughout the entire game to see what that's like.I'm definitely looking forward to Sniper Elite 3. Might grab the first one to see how it all started.

content:
Posted: April 14
												Sniper Elite v2 is a third person stealth shooter from Rebellion software. It shares it's gameplay mechanics with Sniper Ghost Warrior series, but in a WW2 setting.As a, surprise surprise, sniper you'll operate behind enemy lines to eliminate some prominent nazi generals, explode rockets and help allies win WW2. Sniper Elite v2 is a game for rather patient people, it's kinda like Hitman. You should move unseen and eliminate or avoid enemies quietly. You can try to run and gun, but the main character is not bulletproof and dies in a few shots. Kinda like Agent 47.It's a good enough stealth game, even if it has some annoying issues. Mechanically the game is solid, the sneaking usually works, the shooting usually works, but sometimes it doesn't. Enemies might spot you through trees, from 300 meters, and shoot you through these trees to death. The sometimes odd camera will not show you the guy that is just around the corner and as soon as he sees you the whole map will know where you are. Some enemies will bug into a car or tree just to unbug at the perfect moment to break your cover and start shooting at you. So yeah, the game can be annoying. And the worst thing, one level where you're forced into close quarters. Ugh, that one is bad.Still, it's like WW2 Hitman with the possibility to shoot people in the head over long distances with nice slowmos of their vital organs being shattered into tiny pieces. It's actually quite cool. The game is not too short and not too long and should take about 10hrs on normal difficulty. The story is there, it's not too bad, a good excuse for some long distance headshots.I liked:* shooting people over long distances* cool slowmos of gruesome headshots* when sneaking and sniping works it's really cool* not too long not too short* the gfx in generalI disliked:* jerky animations* AI that can see you from 300m and can be deadly accurate with a machine gunGet this if:* WW2 Hitman seems interesting enough for youDon't get this if:* you're more of a run and gun type fellow* you can't stomach glitches and/or occasionally unfair AI

content:
Posted: March 24, 2013
												An otherwise bland sniper game made somewhat memorable by its innovative features. V2 is great testicle-shooting fun for about 3 hours, but then it quickly gets overwhelming. Bullet ballistics were advanced and the simulation seemed quite a bit more accurate than other shooters. Getting long-distance kills was very satisfying, mainly because of the gory bullet-cam that displays your bullets entering your opponent's body and wreaking havoc on his organs.I would have loved for the sniping fun to continue, but all the sudden the game overwhelms you with massive numbers of... tanks. Yes, I said tanks. Literally, you're on the ground with no cover, trying to shoot a tiny fuel cap that will blow the thing up. All while it's pumping you with bullets. The game also incorporates a story, but it's bland and forgettable. Graphics are on-par with a decent game released in 2009, minus the bullet-cam (best bullet-cam ever).Multiplayer sucks. You all know how much it hurts to get sniped from across the map within a few seconds of spawning. Imagine this, but in a game with poor level design... where the only class is sniper. That, and there's almost never anyone playing.The price is horrific. Honestly, don't even think about spending $50 on this. If it goes on sale for under $15, you might want to consider it-- but don't expect too much.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												So you shoot people in this game. Yay. I got this game for free when Steam was giving it away one day, so really the only thing this game had to do was not be completely bad and I would be satisfied. Free games do that.What I saw was that this game actually isn't half-bad. I did have a nasty bug that crashed my game on the third level, but a fix for that was found and I encountered no other problems of that sort. Thus I was allowed to focus on what the game wanted me to do: to sneak around and put bullets in people's heads. Yeeeey. So you are an American sniper person sneaking around Berlin in 1945 and shooting some people who apparently deserve it. But since most of your targets are Nazi's, I suppose they do. Or you can just tell yourself they do and it can actually be a little convincing. Less able to be rationalized away is when you have to shoot Russians, which are allied with the US when the game is taking place, but apparently they deserve it too. So its a cold war game set in the closing days of WW2. That pretty much tells you all you need to know about the plot, and that narrative is certainly not what you should be looking for in this game.No, this game is about ending people. And in that regard, it can be pretty good. The slow-motion camera that tracks your bullet and lets you watch it kaboom their insides is a little creepy, but its not a deal-breaker. You can set traps so enemies sneaking up on you go boom instead, shooting when loud noises are happening can mask the sound of your shot, and you can actually be sneaky in this game and not have to kill everyone you see... sometimes. Sadly this game takes you away from the sneaky gameplay sometimes and puts you into big firefights against lots of enemies who are all trying to kill you. So that is a bit of a shame. Also enemy snipers can sometimes be really hard to find. But the game itself is functional at least, so you don't have to worry about bizarre bugs or (completely) brainless AI behavior.Really when it comes down to it though... even with its flaws, this game actually does let you play as a sniper who sneaks to a position, picks out a target, and then turns their head into goo. If that is something you want to do, then this is a pretty decent game for that. :)

content:
Posted: June 10, 2014
												So, I spent some time with Sniper Elite V2, here. Overall, it's a 6/10, and I will explain why.Initially, I got this game on the day it was free, so it scores some bonus points for not costing me any dosh. I installed it right away, excited about a WW2 Sniper shooter! I went in expecting levels with a wide variety of paths, ways to complete your goals, and all sorts of neato things like that. However, I was somewhat disappointed. I write this on finishing the campaign on the Sniper Elite, or Hard, Difficulty of the game.   Over a mind numbing 8 or so hours of dying, dying some more, crawling before dying, and dying again, I finally finished. On these 8 hours, I have to say that the campaign is fairly linear in the paths you can take, with only a few special spots you can get up in that give you any real advantage over the super aim of enemy soldiers. There's not many ways to skin the cat either, when it comes to completing goals or shooting targets. There's one set vantage point, or one set way to stop a convoy of vehicles, etc. I will applaud the story, though, for obtaining my interest and keeping it through the duration of the campaign.  On the story, it's somewhat generic, and I won't spoil it in this review. It was enough of a fresh breath, though, compared to the games around it that it stands out.   Mechanics wise, the bullet drop is interesting. Not as punishing or realistic as Red Orchestra 2, but not as rediculously cheesy as a game like COD. The cover system is mediocre, with your body sometimes sticking out enough for enemies to be able to shoot you, and on sniper elite, this will kill you every time. Enemy detection works alright, and the AI is fairly cohesive. I found myself flanked from time to time, and they aren't grenade spammy.   I don't care about graphics, so that doesn't weigh into this score. The multiplayer is fun with friends, and so is the co-op. Otherwise, don't bother.Overall, this game is a short, interesting little game about killing Nazis and Reds. Would I buy it? Only on sale. Would I reccommend it to friends? No. 6/10, and I'll probably wind up getting more time in it playing co-op matches and free for alls with friends, and having a grand time of it.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												I've found Sniper Elite V2 a very satisfying game. It runs incredibly smoothly on my laptop, despite the seemingly high-end graphics. It loads fast, it runs fast, and the gameplay, while repetitive, has yet to get boring.Like Thief and Hitman, Sniper Elite V2 is very much a stealth game, although when the sh-- hits the fan, things can get tense and fast-paced very quickly. For the most part, though, you are encouraged to sneak and be deceptive in your kills. A silenced pistol is handy for close encounters, while your trusty sniper rifle is, of course, the most satisfying. Still, there's something to be said for the satisfaction you feel when you hear a trip mine you placed go off.Like Max Payne, Sniper Elite V2 has a "bullet time" effect you can activate while sniping, slowing down the gameplay and allowing you to aim smoother and even zoom in a tiny bit more. It really helps when you're trying to line up a headshot against a guy ducked behind a barrel who you can barely see. And 75% of the time, when you fire, the game cuts to a slow-mo tracking cam of the bullet as it speeds towards its victim, and displays the trajectory of the projectile through the victim's body/head, somewhat like one of the more recent Mortal Kombat game's fatalities. It's a rather cool effect, and thankfully it doesn't hold you up when you're trying to kill a bunch of people at once.The only complaint I have for the game is the submachine gun, which, when mixed with the third person pov, can be very difficult to aim when used in an emergency, and really, the only time you want to be using it is when you're suddenly getting dogpiled by a ton of soldiers, so it's rather frustrating to have to lift the gun to aim and have your crosshair be completely off from where you think it would be.Honestly, I got the game for free when they were giving it away, but knowing now how much fun it is, I would gladly have bought it.

Posted: July 13, 2014
												I got this game when it was free on steam, and I am so happy that I was able to.If you enjoy action-packed third-person shooters, especially set in the WWII timeline, then you will really like this game.The aesthetics are fantastic! When using the sniper rifle, the kill cam will activate (quite often), providing a slow motion, x-ray view of where your bullet pierces the enemy. You can see things like the rib cage exploding, the testicles rupturing, etc. My personal favorite was when I headshotted someone, and the bullet exited and ricocheted (more like bounced, it didn't even move in a straight line) to the person standing next to him, resulting in a double kill. The music is also very good, creating intense firefights. The story is pretty basic, one man's mission to cripple the Nazi regime Rambo-style.The controls are typical of an action shooter, not at all diffcult to familiarize yourself with. The learning curve is moderate, as the game's difficulty requires a lot of preplanning if you intend to survive (especially on the hard difficulty) against the enemy. There are collectibles like these wine bottles you need to shoot, and gold bars you can pick up, which entice achievement junkies to explore most of each map.The game is a lot of fun, with multiple ways to complete your missions (stealth vs. guns blazings creates interesting scenarios). For example, you can try to snipe the gas valve on that enemy tank, or you could shoot the explosive next to it that you had planted in the beginning of the mission. Setting your traps (trip-wire bombs, antipersonnel mines) to deter the enemy and moving to different vantage points really makes you feel like a sniper deep in enemy territory.Try this game if you are interested in action shooters, with sniping as a critical element.Definitely recommend.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2013
												Sniper Elite V2 is a satisfying WW2 shooter taken from the perspective of an awesome sniper. The game is about the sniper stopping the V2 missiles from being launched but really, you probably won't care about the story. This game is all about the satisfying sniping mechanics. When you pull of a long distance shot, the game will follow that bullet in slow motion and show you where you hit the enemy and what bones you shattered. The game is extremely brutal but that is part of the fun. The game offers high difficulties that will make the sniping even more satisfying with more things to take into account such as the wind and how it will affect the destination of the bullet, and general bullet drop based on distance. The game doesn't offer a great amount of weapons for you to choose from but they all feel pretty great to use. The campaign in this game isn't all that long. You can finish it within 6-10 hours depending on the difficulty and how you progress through the stealth sections. One mode I can't really comment on is the coop in this game because unfortunately, I have no friends that wish to play this with me and I couldn't find anyone online. If you wish to get more out of this game, be sure to have a friend that wants to play it as well since the coop is dead. The sound in this game was pretty great and the graphics were good. The challenge maps were pretty good and it was pretty satisfying to shoot Hitler straight in the balls. 75 + 5 for being able to shoot Hitler in the balls and have an awesome bullet cam for it. 80/100

content:
Posted: May 13, 2016
												Sniper Elite V2 is a fun sniping orientated 3rd person shooter. In this game you play as a generic American White male with no backstory sent to single handedly take out hundreds of nazis. Bullet ballistics can be tweaked to be affected by wind, gravity, or nothing for a casual experience. The game does allow you to equip a secondary SMG and pistol but close quarters combat is usually not the correct play because you die very easily in this game. Enemy AI is competent enough to try to flank you while a sniper or mg nest pins you down.The shooting feels and sounds great. Also the by now iconic gore kill cams of the series are of course present and do a good job at breaking up the monotony of the otherwise very basic combat. There's nothing like seeing the same bullet enter the heart of one enemy and exit out te testicles of another. :) The kill cam can be turned off or lessened. Stealth is by far the most fun and effective way to play this game. However this is where the game's greatest issue surfaces. While the original sniper elite was about open levels where stealth was incredibly encouraged, Sniper Elite V2's levels feel like guided linear corridors in comparison. Stealth is also just not always an option sometimes which is frustrating. Enemy AI is for the most part decent. However, one annoyance was that if you are detected by one enemy soldier, for some reason literally all other enemies in the vicinity will immediately know your exact location. The game also has co-op missions/hoard mode which has no one playing it atm and multiplayer which is still active with a very small community. That being said as someone in US WEST, the closest server to me had a ping of over 500. Overall the base game is great fun but even for the somewhat low base price of 20 USD I say perhaps wait for a sale unless you really love sniping games. I usually take my time with games but for this game the main campaign literally took me only 6 hours to beat on the "medium" difficulty.As for the DLC, Neudorf features an open map that shows that the majority of the main game's maps should've been like. Aka decent sized maps where you can choose how to tackle the objective and use stealth. Landwehr is the hardest one by far which 100% requires stealth or you will lose. St. Pierre is extremely mediocre. All the mentioned DLC take about an hour each to beat which honestly isn't enough content for full price. Kill Hitler might seem cool at first... that is until you realize that you are paying 8 USD for a mission that is literally 20 minutes long.

content:
Posted: November 15, 2014
												The Good:  I got the game for freeThe Bad: The levels and game-play are repetive.  Often times you will find yourself in the "same" buidling even in different places in the same map.  The encounters tend to blur together after a while.  Its all the same stuff over and over.  I would say that the only difference is the back-drop, but even that is mostly the same.The ugly:  The AI is insanely bad.  Enemies will happly re-position themselves in the same exact spot, the spot that contains a pile of corpses and proceed to quickly add to that pile.   The game sends waves of enemies after you, and each wave will do the same exact thing.  So you just fight the battle you just fought 2 or even 3 times in a row.  It is also annoying how you can "clear" an area of enemies, and then step over some invisible line and suddenly a new wave of guys appears out of thin-air.  Sometimes from rooms behind you with no possible way for them to have gotten past you.Once the AI is "aggroed", it will always know where you are.  It is both amusing and sad to see a bunch of the AI dudes tracking you though solid walls, standing there shooting at you endlessly.  They almost NEVER seek you out beyond thier scripted pattern of movement.  They could just run into a building or up some stairs to get you, but unless it is a scripted event they will stand there shooting at you through the walls, floors or celings.I have played enough of this game and I just can't take it anymore.  If you are bored, I wouldn't pay more than $1.99 for it.  I did manage to get 7 hours out of it before I couldn't stomach it anymore.

Posted: June 5, 2014
												I've read about these games and I always felt they would never appeal to me as I thought it was just a boring game where you sniped people and had to score points and reach a target to unlock the next level sort of system, but I bit the bullet (excuse pun) and tried the demo and to be honest I was actually wrong. The game isn't that bad and the sniping mechs are in line with Fallouts V.A.T.S system and the bullet time is also like it if you needed an example but this game takes that system and slightly tweaks it to make it a bit more realistic with the way bullets actually hurt people by showing what damage it actually does to the body. And it's here where the game is made around to be honest if it didn't have this more realistic view of bullet time then the game would fall flat slightly as there's isn't much to do but follow on screen prompts to progress the level and basically get the best shots for the best points per kill.It may sound very boring and repeative but it's not too bad and the way you clear out a set of enemies is up to you my problem is I am armed with landmines which can be placed under bodies etc but you never know where the enemy will spawn as you progress until you've played that mission before so you can then plant them in places before they appear. The game's graphics are very nice and can even be high demanding I can play at HIGH with VSYNC on at 4X antitropsic, 1920x1080p@60hz and I have a i7 2600k, 8GB DDR3 1600hz Crucial Ballistix RAM, 2GB 7850 GPU and if I put it up even more I get sluggishness, On HIGH it looks great so be prepared to push your system with this game for better graphics.

content:
Posted: June 5, 2014
												(Ignore my low amount of play time on this game. I've played the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of the demo, and have completed the Wii U version on various difficulties, and also played and completed the original game from 2005.)PROS:+Decent PC port, has a good amount of graphic, display, control, gameplay, and audio options, runs okay on my crappy laptop on lowest settings.+Pretty cool DLC that lets you fight an army of Nazi Zombies, and/or kill Hitler himself!+Solid sniping mechanics, accounting for variables like wind, heart rate, and distance.+Adjustable difficulty levels for AI, sniping, and in game assistance.+Bullet cam is cool as ♥♥♥♥.IN-BETWEEN:+/- Soundtrack is okay, but nothing memorable.+/- Graphics aren't the best, but not the worst either.+/- Voice acting is better than that of the first game, but that's not saying much.+/- Levels look nice, but are very linear in design.+/- SMGs and Pistols are effective for close quarter combat, but it can also take over a full Thompson mag to kill one guy.CONS:-Karl Fairburne (player character) still has less personality than a piece of cardboard.-The brown palette of the original Sniper Elite has been replaced with various shades of blue and white!-Generic, tacked on multiplayer.-Open ended levels of the original have been replaced with more linear ones, with some exceptions.-AI are dumb as rocks on all difficulties for the most part.-In the original you had a more realistic health system, with each part of the body slowly getting damaged the more you get shot there, you needed medkits to survive. Too much damage to your legs, and you'll need to crawl to safety, headshot and it's game over. In here however, you have regenerating health and the ability to take cover from almost anywhere, so you might as well be the ♥♥♥♥ing Terminator.-Long loading screens.OVERALL:Fans of the orignal might not enjoy it as much, but anybody new to this franchise will probably like it.

												Awesome game, really fun, has the possiblity to play with friends and doesn't require much from the computer to run at 120 fps. One of the things that diferentiate it from other FPS snipers is the Bullet Travel Time, and Bullet Drop, meaning that the bullet takes more time to reach it's target and will go down due to gravity. Lower dificultys make it so enemys do less damage, makes the physics less realistcs, therefore making the game easier, however, the Sniper Elite dificulty makes it so that there is more realistic physics, enemies do ridiculous amounts of damage and eliminates the little Square that marks where your bullets are going to go, and to go around that, you have a stealth mechanic, different explosive armaments to make traps or to use in direct combat, such as grenades, land mines and trip mines

content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												Simple story guides you through a series of missions that test your sniper skills. Sniping is pretty much what this game is all about and it does it well, with the kill xray cam adding to the general experience. It's fun to play if you only have a couple of minutes to get you to a next checkpoint or if you have a cople of hours to actually finish the whole game in one go. Aside from that however it doesn't have much to offer, the levels are simple, straithforward and linear with pretty much only one way to finish them, still the simplicity of design does not negate the generally positive feeling of fun it provides. Co-op missions are pretty much the same as single player with few instances where one of the players is a spotter and does not have a sniper rifle. Multiplayer wise everyone is a sniper and depending on the mode selected you either kill everyone else or the enemy team. Overall a solid piece of fun especially if like me you got it for free on the 24h super special deal they had going about a month ago:)7/10

												I picked up Sniper Elite during their promotion yesterday and for a free game, it is a great one. Interesting storyline and gameplay that gives an interesting view as to what it means to be a wartime sniper.However, some of the bugs really take away from what this game could be. content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												Good Game, But It Needs ImprovementThis is a great game; it captures a lot of depth into how long range bullet ballistics and historical facets of WWII. But it desperately needs to be reworked to fit. There will be many times within the game where you will be forced to think not as a sniper, but a Rambo style killing machine. The beginnings, half-way points, and endings will decently fit the bill as using precision skill and timing with your rifle. As in, scripted parts of the game. But in-between those key points it asks you to do things in another fashion. Such as level's two and three. In 2 you're in many tight corridors, so you have lots of straight shots. But you have zero visibility, enemies running up to you and killing you because you're on the ground, and enemies that will actually spawn before your eyes in the same tunnel. This means that your rifle is practically useless and your best choice is using your machine gun and running. Next we have level 3. Again, lots of tight corridors, low visibility, and more enemies that spawn only when you come within a certain close distance. Your only choice on any difficulty higher than the average is machine guns and running. It's a great game and I love it for its sniping parts, but it needs to be that at least most of the time, not a Call of Duty esc rampage. And I am sorry for using that comparison, but the Duty series appers to be the benchmark that the developers making this went for.

Posted: June 20, 2014
												Pretty good game. Picked it up during the free day and wanted to try it out. The campaign was alright. Quite enjoyable with different tactics despite the linear gameplay. Tutorial was annoying and unhelpful but then again most games' tutorials are anyway. I have enjoyed what I have played so far of the singleplayer despite the story not massively gripping me.The multiplayer isn't my sort of thing. I love stealth games but only when there's something to kill. Finding players in this is pretty difficult. The multiplayer is very slow paced for such small maps. I personally prefer fast pace in small areas (TF2 sort of thing) and slower paced, more tactical in large areas (such as battlefield). I thought the maps would be quite large considering it's sniping but then again it would make it difficult to find people. The worst part was the map I played was from the campaign and I'm guessing it's the same with the others. That's something I don't like as I personally like the SP to offer a different experience from the MP.Good singleplayer, Okay multiplayer.6/10

content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
												I felt like the developers put everything into the sniping aspect of this game. As the name intends, it is Sniper Elite. However, what does this title promise for the game? It leads to exactly what it is; sniping. While this is not bad, the rest of the game is very lackluster. The maps you are set in for the campaign are very linear with very little to explore, and even if you decide to, you'll be trying to look for something to keep your interest. Sniper Elite is a game full of running, shooting, and..... that's mainly it. Stealth should be a key element in a game like this, correct? Stealth only dictates whether you have an easier time or not as your rifle holds the most ammo. The designers obviously had a reason behind this, and it's in your best interest to take all the time it requires to finish one of these linear levels. The environment is uninteractive as well. The most you can do is vault over things; mainly required as it's rare you'll do this on your own. Overall, the game is boring after the first mission and is un immersive.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												Whiteman Mcgenericsoldier has to save London and the free world from both Germanazis and Commuruskies.If you go into this gam expecting a hyper realistic sniper simulator, you're gonna be disapointed. However, if you just want a fun and exciting experience like in war and action movies, then this is your game.The story is a bit, well, BEHINDERT and since there are like, what, 2 talking characters (you included) you can't be expected to really give a SCHEIß about the whole plot n' drama. But who needs a story when you can shoot a grenade on someone's belt and start a chainreaction of explosions? Who cares about plot when you make that sweet shot right through the scope and eye of an enemy sniper? And most importantly: All this GEILE ♥♥♥♥E can be done in co-op. YES. Finaly, a game remembers that co-op storymode is like the pasties on a stripdancer's nipples. Sure, boobies on their own are neat-o and filled with hopes and dreams, but the pasties make that♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥like, 10 times more fantastic to watch.In addition, there are also challenges where you and your co-op KAMERAD have to rummage through the Berlin ruins in search for vehicle parts to fix a car/plane/tank. This can be balls-to-the-walls-hard, but seeing that cutscene when you finish it with all the explosions and alarms going off will make you smile the stupidest grin you've had in a while.Teeny-weeny minus point is the repetetive german of the germans, with highly quotable lines. It sometimes has a jarring, sort of "wrong" accent, but its better then just english with german accent. Oh oh oh also, the game has custom made propaganda posters that are pretty fitting and look like they could have been real. No more dutch and norwegian SS propaganda on every wall nearby....(I'm looking at you, CoD, Wolfenstein, Red Orchestra etc.)

content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												I keep looking in the distance for gunmen in windows of derelict buildings and roof tops.The crux of enjoyment for me is taking out fellow snipers 100+ metres away. This alone is hugely enjoyable: from lining up your shot, choosing whether to take a body shot or a more risky head-shot(instant kill).You star in a detailed war zone where you have multiple adversaries in varied scenes. This is different to your average shooter. The rewards are for accurate shooting, long distance shooting, head shots, shooting through 2 people with 1 shot, even shooting someone through the nuts(the slow-mo kill-cam is extraordinarily detailed). The game is more enjoyable when played with patience; although there are some non-sniper scenes(usually in buildings) where you choose a rapid fire gun to take out the enemy. For every mission you choose your rifle, machine gun, pistol and grenades/dynamite etc.If you ever enjoy those long distance shots in fps games then this will be a perfect alternative to the thousand of mindless shooters out there. Overall: a superb shooter with detailed graphics and addictive gameplay.

content:
Posted: April 16, 2013
												Sniper Elite V2 is nothing like the original Sniper Elite. This game has kept just the name and the general setting. EVERYTHING else is different. You play an OSS agent sent into Berlin to prevent Nazi scientists from falling into Soviet hands, but you soon discover things are not that simple. You can carry three weapons: a sniper rifle, a sub machine gun, and a pistol, plus some mines, grenades, and such. You need to make your way through enemies (both German and Russian) including infatry and snipers, plus tanks, armored cars, trucks, and more, and accomplish your objective, whether it be assassination, sabotage, or rescue. The best part about this game, is of course, "bullet cam" where you follow your bullet leaving your gun all the way to where it impacts the enemy. With SEV2, you get a new "CSI style" bullet cam that shows you exactly what happened to the target of your bullet, including blood spatter, breaking bones, and ruptured organs, as if you're looking at an X-ray. (You can turn that off if you wish). The game also added "collectibles" (Nazi gold, and wine bottles) to encourage some exploration of the level. There's also various battles against AI and/or playing co-op on certain missions. All in all, SEV2 is a fun game, if a bit watered down from the original sandbox vision. Eye candy, on the other hand, is excellent.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2014
												I was lucky enough to get this game for free the day before Sniper Elite III came out. While the game rewards you for droppin' Nazis without detection, the number of enemies present in a given level usually only makes that possible in close quarters when you can use your silenced pistol, and that's not too sniper-y, eh? The player goes through a tutorial that gives the impression of carefully scouting a location, setting up all manners of nasty tricks to stop them bad guys, then taking a shot in the perfect position and moving so that you're a step ahead once detected. Thing is, it only plays out like that until you shoot your rifle and, oh look! More Nazis coming from around the block! Better stay in the same position and snipe a wave or two, maybe lay down a trip mine behind me in case they sneak up while I'm trying to fend off a dozen or so coming up the road. Not to say this isn't fun, it's just that the meat of the gameplay isn't nearly as calculated as it was set up to be, and I would have liked it better that way. The shooting is a lot of fun; the x-ray bullet cam is great, the "breathing system"  I guess you could call it is great (try running up to the top of a building, trying to get a shot on an enemy who's getting away in a car, only to find you're out of breath and the scope is moving all over the place. Adrenaline!) though these both tend to get old, again due to the sheer number of enemies that require bullets to the skull and/or groin. All of this raises a question: is it possible to make a carefully calculated sniper game when it's still the player vs. the world, huge environments and armies pitted against you like every other military shooter? Sniper Elite V2 is nearly there, and it's compelling enough to make you want to finish the game. Will I now buy Sniper Elite III as Steam's promotion intended? Maybe, I'm curious to see whether the creators have improved upon the formula. Would I buy V2 for $30? Probably not, but then again, why would you buy any two year old game on Steam for $30? It'll go on sale eventually...

content:
Posted: July 15, 2014
												This seemed like a good sniper game to me, and if you generally like this type of game, I think you'll like this specific game.  I played it on the easy/casual difficulty, and it took me 7 hours or so to make it through the single player campaign.  I'm not a great player, so even with the easier aiming and less deadly enemies, it still took a few tries to clear each mission.  I'm glad there were checkpoints, so I didn't have to start each one over from the beginning when I died.You play solo here, but have some items besides guns you can use to help you out:  land mines, trip mines, grenades, etc.  They're not really necessary -- I finished single player and used them rarely, if at all -- but they probably do make things easier.  At the medium and hard difficulties, enemies are stronger and more bullet ballistics come into play, like bullets dropping over distance due to gravity, which makes things noticeably harder.  I started a single player game on medium difficulty to try it out, and after 20 minutes I still hadn't cleared the first training mission.  (Like I said, I'm not a great player.)  I haven't tried multi-player or co-op, but having additional play modes like that is nice.There were enough missions for a story to develop, and it took a nice amount of time to play through.  On the easy level for me, it wasn't too easy, and it wasn't frustratingly difficult or long.  I almost always felt like I was making progress, even when retrying after dying, which was definitely good.  There seems to be some replay value, too, even if it's just working through harder difficulties than the last time.  And thanks to those multiple difficulty levels, this game can be enjoyable for casual gamers as well as more dedicated gamers.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Originally played the demo for this on Xbox 360 and thought that while the X-Ray bullet kill cam was a cool gimmick, it would get old fast.I was wrong.Picked this up for free on Steam during a 24-hour special sale period and I have been plugging along at it bit by bit.  It's fun in its own way - you have to scope out each mission, make some quick decisions as to how you're going to approach it, and (after dying a few times) perfect it so you can last as long as possible without being detected.  I'm not sure it's possible to go through an entire mission without being spotted by the enemy, but that's fine with me - stealth games haven't always been my favorite, anyway.Only a couple of downsides:1. The various traps and things you can set to protect yourself I find to be usually worthless to me personally, as I tend to move around a lot.  I'm not sure if that's just my style or if it's because I don't find myself in situations often where I have been able to anticipate hordes of enemies coming at me while having to snipe others in the distance.2. When zoomed in, my framerate drops to about half of what it is in normal view.  I don't have the best computer in the world by any stretch of the imagination, but it does get annoying nonetheless (makes it very hard to line up shots quickly).That having been said, the death cams are awesome, and I'm just having fun in general working my way through the various missions and locales.  In the end, that's all that matters to me, anyway.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2014
												This sniping-stealth hybrid is the second in s series of games made by Rebellion, who've had some interesting ideas in the past with titles like Neverdeadbut tend to have terrible execution with titles like Alien Vs. Predator. Does this game fall into the same trap of good potential yet bad execution like so many others? We shall see. This game revolves around an American special ops soldier (this is what must be assumed, he never interacts with another person) whose name is also never revealed. All of his mission breifings are done by himself and any other human being he ever comes across ends up horrifically dead. For all we know he could be some nut running around Germany at the end of the war.Mr. Whitebread here has the objective of killing a series of German scientists who worked on the V2 rockets before they fall into the hands of the Russian menace. So you kill both Germans AND Russians. This is when we were still allied with them, keep in mind. You of course prevail and destroy the V2 rockets and their creators, of course.As the title indicates, you are a sniper. And this game deosnt have simple CoD esqe sniping, no, this game has the advanced ballistics on higher difficulties. There is bullet drop (which without indication on the higher difficulties, results in the guessing game) and fairly realistic enemy reactions to bullets. You fire at somone in the head, they die, you fire at somone in the heart. they die. Same goes for the lungs, stomach, and yes, testicles. While it has realism with vital organ hits, it still takes an unrealisitc number of hits at any other part of the body. There is also a kill-cam, in which if you hit a vital are on an enemy, the camera may do a stylized folling of the kill. It follows the bulet in slow motion and shows the impact in slow motions (sometimes x-ray, even more gruesome). This mechanic is very entertaining at the beggining but starts to become flow-killing after some time. You can turn it off as well as change how much it happens, but on default settings it happens too much for a decent flow.Graphically, the game is okay. It has decent looking effects and for a game that came out two years ago, looks good. Considering how basic the levels are though, it could certainly be better. It is also pretty well optimized, allowing for older machines to play as well.The sniping is undoubtedly the best aspect of this game, with a fairly disastorous attempt at stealth. To impliment good stealth into a game, you MUST have good AI. AI that is fairly predictable (as to make it possible to play) and acts like a human being. The enimies in this game can hear you if you move at more than a duck-walk from hundreds of feet away, or will go back to normal patrols after seeing their friends have his brains blown out right before his eyes. In short, the AI is all over the place. Another aspect to good stealth games is level design. Giving you options upon where to go, what entrence to take, how to deal with your foes. In my opinion, the best stealth games allow you to get through a level without ever taking an enemy out or ever knowing you were there. Here, you are forced to kill every last person you come across and are forced through very linear and lifeless enviornments. All in all, much is left to be desired and some may find it simply unejoyable.In addition to the few campaign missions, there are two other game modes. The first is a co-op gamemode in which you play through the singleplayer levels with another person. Lack of dedicated co-op maps should be the first red flag here, simply placing two people in an already prepared mission shows extreme laziness. It also results in levels being far too easy, even on full difficulty, with two players fighting where one was designed ro be. From there it feels more competative than cooperative, with the players fighting over kills and objecives. In short, co-op is very tacked on. The multiplayer on the other hand is argueable the most fun part of the game. Most of the game modes are standard, team deathmatch, free-for-all, CTF, and so on. There is however Team Distance King and Distance King, which encourage the player to make long distance and skillfull shots as to win. Multiplayer here is fun, resulting in tense sniper fights and cooperative gameplay. The maps are fairly open and well designed for sniping. It results in an enjoyable online experience that can well extend the playtime of this game. In conclusion, I'd reccomend Sniper Elite V2 to those who much enjoy sniping and can swallow mediocre stealth, levels and standard graphics, and a very barebones story. This game had very good and big ideas of a WW2 special ops game that could allow the player to feel the tension of a lone wolf sniper operative in enemy territory. It somewhat pulls through with a moderately fun experience 5.5/10

												I keep looking in the distance for gunmen in windows of derelict buildings and roof tops.The crux of enjoyment for me is taking out fellow snipers 100+ metres away. This alone is hugely enjoyable: from lining up your shot, choosing whether to take a body shot or a more risky head-shot(instant kill).You star in a detailed war zone where you have multiple adversaries in varied scenes. For every mission you choose your rifle, machine gun, pistol and grenades/dynamite etc.If you ever enjoy those long distance shots in fps games then this will be a perfect alternative to the thousand of mindless shooters out there. Overall: a superb shooter with detailed graphics and addictive gameplay.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2014
												I was lucky enough to get this game for free the day before Sniper Elite III came out. While the game rewards you for droppin' Nazis without detection, the number of enemies present in a given level usually only makes that possible in close quarters when you can use your silenced pistol, and that's not too sniper-y, eh? The player goes through a tutorial that gives the impression of carefully scouting a location, setting up all manners of nasty tricks to stop them bad guys, then taking a shot in the perfect position and moving so that you're a step ahead once detected. Thing is, it only plays out like that until you shoot your rifle and, oh look! More Nazis coming from around the block! Better stay in the same position and snipe a wave or two, maybe lay down a trip mine behind me in case they sneak up while I'm trying to fend off a dozen or so coming up the road. Not to say this isn't fun, it's just that the meat of the gameplay isn't nearly as calculated as it was set up to be, and I would have liked it better that way. The shooting is a lot of fun; the x-ray bullet cam is great, the "breathing system"  I guess you could call it is great (try running up to the top of a building, trying to get a shot on an enemy who's getting away in a car, only to find you're out of breath and the scope is moving all over the place. Adrenaline!) though these both tend to get old, again due to the sheer number of enemies that require bullets to the skull and/or groin. All of this raises a question: is it possible to make a carefully calculated sniper game when it's still the player vs. the world, huge environments and armies pitted against you like every other military shooter? Sniper Elite V2 is nearly there, and it's compelling enough to make you want to finish the game. Will I now buy Sniper Elite III as Steam's promotion intended? Maybe, I'm curious to see whether the creators have improved upon the formula. Would I buy V2 for $30? Probably not, but then again, why would you buy any two year old game on Steam for $30? It'll go on sale eventually...

												This game again garners mixed feelings from me. It does make me feel like a BADASS sniper instead of some COD rambo, and it is frankly the fps which I have been wanting to play for a long time. Alas, it is marred by the inconsistency in sound( especially explosions), the hit and miss of bullet trajectories, unrealistic hit points ( some guys survive my headshot) and extremely clunky close quarter combat. Skip this game if you hate repetitive missions and cant stand the inaccuracy in ballistics, as the camera X-ray shots can only compensate as far as your tolerance level is.Edit: Well, after playing some multiplayer and getting to know the nuances of crosshair aiming, I have got to say most of the hit and miss of trajectories are my mistake. content:
Posted: June 17, 2014
												You're dropped into the shoes of Karl Fairburne, a German-American soldier sent by the Office of Strategic Services to eliminate key targets associated with the V2 program.To accomplish this, you start the game out with a Welrod Mark I(a silenced and surprisingly effective handgun) and an M1903A4 Springfield Sniper Rifle as well as an M1A1 Thompson for use in emergencies(you only carry one magazine with you for that). These three weapons can of course be exchanged for other variants, if you should find them, but they're all you really need. The Welrod is the only silenced pistol in the entire game, making it especially essential for your survival.The selling point of Sniper Elite V2, however, is the slow motion bullet cam that'll show an "x-ray" of the enemy when you hit them, if the shot is judged well enough by the game.But in general, the whole game feels very... Generic? There aren't too many selling points. The story isn't a blockbuster story, there aren't really any interesting characters, and as a whole the game feels very empty. Still, if you like challenges with semi-realistic bullet physics, I suppose you can't go too wrong with this.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												(SINGLE PLAYER ONLY)This game is about being a WW2-sniper, it's not a modern sniper game, it's not a future sniper game, nor a pre-historic stone archery game, it's WW2. The game is good for what it is supposed to do, sniping and it allows you to choose different difficulties depending on the level of realism you want in the game. Whenever you shoot someone in a critical spot, like the head, testicles or major organs, you see a slowed-down view of the bullet piercing through said bodypart with x-ray and everything. The story is very linear, as you go from place to place,being directed by markers on the map. In certain parts the game is too linear as certain enemies only pop-up when you reach a certain point, and even de-spawn when you go back far enough, thus there is no real point in scouting out and really, planning your battle as you won't have full view of all the enemies and you might not even know that certain enemies were there, until it is too late. The X-ray view of bullets also gets repetitive after a while unless you enjoy watching the animations, which I do, the graphics look quite nice when seeing the special animations.Once you finish the game there is really not much to keep you going back other than collecting hidden bars of gold in every level, and sniping hidden bottles of wine in every level. If you played the game at a lower difficulty it might be fun to try a higher difficulty to see if you're up for the challenge.This game is a one-time thing and will only really hook enthusiasts of this type of game to play again,while it is fun and it works well for what it is supposed to do;that is the only thing.
