content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
												Sniper Elite V2 is a not a particularly great game in any aspect but is fairly amusing, good-looking and adequately challenging most of the time. I would reccomend it, but only if it is on sale and you are a fan of long-distance combat and can accept the lack of any good kind of story.The game features fairly standard cover-based shooting and snipering where your bullet is influenced by wind and drop-off. Aiming is a bit inaccurate when you are not using the sniper, but when  you are using it, in spite of whatever influences your bullet, in my case it became quite easy to just guess where to shoot. And when long-distance sniping is the core mechanic of the game, it makes for the game in general to be quite easy, apart from a few bumps in the difficulty curve. Extraordinarily difficult bits occured when you encountered groups of Russians and Germans fighting eachother, or when you come across a tank. What I did like about it was that you can not just shoot the tank's gas can and cause it to explode, you have to hit the fuel cap instead. That is at the very least a bit more realistic and challenging and is therefore quite fun. Extremely frustrating however was one mission where you are tasked to kill a number of enemy snipers in a big open environment, who kill you with ease and are extremely hard to spot. But leaving aside a few exceptions, the game is no too hard.Graphics are an area where this game shines, although the level of detail is not distributed quite equally. The player character, as well as the NPC's, look very good but the game world is left out a bit at times. In spite of that, the lighting and bright colors make the world pleasant to look at.A few more nice things that this game features is an X-ray style vision of your target when a bullet flies through them, showing exactly what damage you did. What was also well done in my opinion was the feeling the city gave me. With idle conversations in German around me and the aforementioned nice visuals in the city it did manage to convey the atmosphere of the war-torn city. What bothers me most about it is that there is nothing special about it, except for the X-ray thing. The gun mechanics and atmosphere are nice, but it is all you get and that is not enough for some people. The story, for instance, is quite boring. The game is set in Berlin in the last few weeks of World War II and you play as an American sniper sent to kill a few high-ranking German scientists as well as some of the Russians that are invading the city at that time. The biggest problem with the story, apart from the fact that nothing truly interesting or imaginative happens, is that it is only brought across by a voice during the pre-mission menu. This is no aspect of the game that is relevant.I would reccomend this game anyway, because of that it can be something nice if it is on sale and you are looking for nothing else besides amusing gunplay.

Posted: June 17, 2014
												You're dropped into the shoes of Karl Fairburne, a German-American soldier sent by the Office of Strategic Services to eliminate key targets associated with the V2 program.To accomplish this, you start the game out with a Welrod Mark I(a silenced and surprisingly effective handgun) and an M1903A4 Springfield Sniper Rifle as well as an M1A1 Thompson for use in emergencies(you only carry one magazine with you for that). These three weapons can of course be exchanged for other variants, if you should find them, but they're all you really need. The Welrod is the only silenced pistol in the entire game, making it especially essential for your survival.The selling point of Sniper Elite V2, however, is the slow motion bullet cam that'll show an "x-ray" of the enemy when you hit them, if the shot is judged well enough by the game.But in general, the whole game feels very... Generic? There aren't too many selling points. The story isn't a blockbuster story, there aren't really any interesting characters, and as a whole the game feels very empty. Still, if you like challenges with semi-realistic bullet physics, I suppose you can't go too wrong with this.

content:
Posted: March 23, 2015
												Sniper Elite V2 was given away free for a day by Steam a while back, and it went into my backlog because I usually prefer shooters over stealth games. Fortunately, Sniper V2 blends the two genres together successfully and most of the stealth sections are where you’re trying to get to a good enough position to headshot your targets. The game’s difficulty is more customizable than most shooters, so whether you want to casually murder some people from long range, or sneak around silently lining up the perfect muffled shot, it’s up to you.The game takes place during the latter days of World War 2, with you playing the part of an American sniper behind enemy lines in Nazi Germany picking off high value targets as well as trying to get your hands on certain German scientists. The race is on between the US and Soviet Union to grab up all the best Nazi scientists before the other side gets their paws on them. In this case, you’re looking for the scientists who worked on the Nazi V2 rocket program (long range missiles).The gameplay for Sniper Elite V2 is third person shooter except when using the sniper rifle scope, which is first person.  The game is broken up into distinct missions, each being about half an hour long, and you start with all your equipment right from the start of each mission. You have your trusty sniper rifle, a Thompson machine gun, and a silenced pistol, as well as a couple of explosive items such as land mines and trip mines. You can switch out your machine gun with weapons from fallen enemies, but it’s generally a bad idea because the guns you find on the ground have like 5 bullets left in them. Besides, you shouldn’t be using the machine gun much anyways if you’re sneaking around as much as you ought to be. Despite how important being sneaky is, the stealth system in Sniper Elite V2 is not heavily developed. You just crouch down and you’ll be walking silently. There is a colored arrow indicator when enemies are close to spotting you (kind of like Far Cry 3) except it usually happens so fast that as soon as you see it, you’re probably going to be caught.  When you get spotted, an alarm goes up and all the nearby enemies will start gunning for you at your last known location. The game uses a regenerating health system so as long as you don’t take damage for a few seconds, you survive. Of course you shouldn’t really be getting shot much anyways since the highlight of the game is long range sniping.When looking through the scope you have the ability to hold your breath and focus in (steady your aim) on targets as long as you have enough stamina. If you manage a long range shot to an enemy’s vital organs (brain, liver, heart, etc.) the game will do a slow motion kill cam where you see the enemy in x-ray with the bullet piercing through and busting stuff up. It’s pretty cool in the beginning, especially if you just made a really long range shot. The game’s ballistics options let you decide if you want realistic sniper shooting with bullet travel time, bullet drop over distance, and wind trajectory, if you enjoy missing a lot. Pros:+A fun game if you like sniper action. You vs a bunch of soldiers firing at each over long distances. Boom Headsot! If there are bombs dropping the background, you can use the sound of the explosions to cover the sound of your rifle shots. The bad guys won’t even know they’re being picked off one at a time as long as they don’t see bodies. Once the alarm is raised though, just kill everyone.+The stealth sections are fun for the most part when you sneak around with your silenced pistol. The game uses checkpoint saving, so you may end up replaying some sections over and over trying not to get spotted. There’s a Steam achievement for getting through a particular area without being caught and I must have played that section a dozen times before I made it through. +Some multiplayer options are available and there seem to still be people playing the game online. In one multiplayer mode, you can co-op with a friend as your spotter who tags enemies for you to snipe.Cons:-You really do spend a lot of time crouched down trying to be sneaky, which greatly slows your movement speed. So many times I just want to run from point A to B, but I know if I don’t sneak I’ll probably be heard and need to restart the checkpoint. It can be frustrating for someone used to moving fast because unlike some other stealth games, you have no way of knowing whether or not there’s an enemy nearby unless you can directly see him (you don’t have an enemy radar).-There’s not too much variety in gameplay/weapons. You get maybe 3 different types of sniper rifle found through the story, but really they’re pretty much the same. I think the better ones just have larger clips or an additional level of zoom.Overall the game is fun if you just want to get some sniper action and kill a bunch of Nazis. And as a bonus, you may already have this game for free.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2016
												The X-Ray kill cam is cool. For others it gets repetitive and boring, but for me it never really ceases to feel good.Ballistics are pretty alright but definitely exaggerrated for reasons I'll detail below.Those are about the only things good about the game.So yes, it's a WW2 shooter with the !!twist!! that you're a sniper, and you have to infiltrate enemy territory and assassinate critical targets with (almost) no backup at all.Maps are really linear, and don't offer the tactical opportunities an actual sniper would really like to get. They are also pretty damn small for real sniping, yet the reasons you don't want to go in with your secondary weapons are their abysmal accuracy, even when prone, abysmal recoil and little available ammo. Stealth isn't an option most of the time, or even something like relocation after firing a shot - kill or miss, doesn't matter, the AI will be permanently alerted, and no amount of hiding or moving away will stop them from repeating the same "Find him" or "Come out, sniper" lines over and over. Not to mention how they will just endlessly try to bumrush you on higher difficulties, again violating one's common sense to take cover then slowly move up and flank you. The real difficulty comes from them spotting you from absolutely anywhere you poke even a polygon through - a little crevace, in a dark room, a hundred meters away, it doesn't matter - they will still see you, and will keep firing in automatic bursts across that same distance and hit you 3/4 of the time.Realism only really extends to the sniper ballistics, and even those are exaggerrated for the sake of giving the illusion the maps are really bigger than they appear to be. There's no sight zeroing but you do have a part bullet time, part "eliminate 90% of idle scope sway" hold breath mechanic. Sounds are exaggerrated as well with lots of echoing even in areas which shouldn't have echoes.You frequently end up in shooting gallery sections, where enemies funnel down a corridor and you are expected to deal with them either with a slow(-ish) firing rifle (which can admittedly penetrate multiple dudes) or with the same abysmal secondaries mentioned above. This goes pretty much against everything a sniper is supposed to do in the area of operations.Speaking of snipers, f*** the enemy snipers. They spawn in difficult places, with the only hint of their existence being an occasional scope glare and (on lower difficulties) an arrow pointing in their direction. Even when they are on the move, they have near perfect aim and WILL get at least one shot on you, every time, until you memorise their spawning positions and ice them.I got this for free, and honestly I was really hyped the first time I learned of this game just before release. The sparkle and spectacle quickly wore down as it slowly turns like most other WW2 first/third person shooters with some mind boggling design choices.If I were you, I'd not pick this game just because it advertises having wind affect ballistics, which many other such games seem to lack.

Posted: October 18, 2015
												Well, how should i say this?Sniper Elite V2 is a god damn good-looking game, with realistic physics and well-made characteristics.The bullet effect has been made well, and most of the gruesome kills really look cool.The is not very complex, but it's easily catchable. There are 4 different difficulty levels to choose from;"Cadet" (easy), "Marksman" (intermediate), "Sniper Elite" (hard), and "Custom"I myself played the game with Marksman, and i must say, i died only one (1) time on campaign mode.The way game makes itself harder, is by adding more realistic physics; like gravity and wind.You'll take some more damage from enemies, but not too much.The game itself is not so long, as i played trough the campaign within 5.6 hours.Allthough there are some bonus collectibles, as Bottles & Gold Bars.These items do make some kind of replay value, but i myself am not that type of person, who enjoys collectibles.There is an access for a Multiplayer Game. The Multiplayer Mode is not the best way to enjoy about the game.The gameplay is basically same as it is in the Single Player Mode (campaign).There are multiple game modes, but the most popular ones must be;DM (Deathmatch) - this means you versus other playersTDM (Team Deathmatch) - this is variation of Deathmatch, you and your team try to wipe out other team.CTF (Capture the Flag) - steal the flag and take it to your base.The game mode i played most, is the TDM. The games are just silly. The snipers job is camping and shooting people.But this is just not good with 12 players on same server. The idea is great, but the execution is not.Most of the multiplayer game time goes by hiding behind rocks and bushes and trying to snipe other people.Doing the exact same. I recommend you to skip the Multiplayer Mode for better gaming experience.tl;dr?Sniper Elite V2 looks cool & acts cool, the gameplay is realistic & well-made. It's a Single Player game.If you like Sniping & Bullet Effects besides Nazi Plot & Manly Protagonist, i recommend you to buy this game.

Posted: August 5, 2014
												Sniper Elite V2 is a great game for newbies like myself who want a taster of a stealth game.The balancing of the game is skewed towards the player with health regen and no insta-death.  Which is a good thing as it plays right into the hands of recreational players.  The maps and graphics are immersive.While shooting meat over and over again is repetitive, there is good variation in the map and the environment.  You may be sniping long range in an open area, or using a silenced pistol to take out enemies in tight indoor areas at close range.  Climbing up flights of stairs is always heart-stopping as you never know what is waiting for you at the top.If you're an experienced Splinter Cell gamer who look to play a serious stealth game, this isn't for you.  There is also limited replay value as the enemy positioning is the same every time you die and reload from the previous checkpoint.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
												Sniper Elite V2 is a not a particularly great game in any aspect but is fairly amusing, good-looking and adequately challenging most of the time. I would reccomend it, but only if it is on sale and you are a fan of long-distance combat and can accept the lack of any good kind of story.The game features fairly standard cover-based shooting and snipering where your bullet is influenced by wind and drop-off. Aiming is a bit inaccurate when you are not using the sniper, but when  you are using it, in spite of whatever influences your bullet, in my case it became quite easy to just guess where to shoot. And when long-distance sniping is the core mechanic of the game, it makes for the game in general to be quite easy, apart from a few bumps in the difficulty curve. Extraordinarily difficult bits occured when you encountered groups of Russians and Germans fighting eachother, or when you come across a tank. What I did like about it was that you can not just shoot the tank's gas can and cause it to explode, you have to hit the fuel cap instead. That is at the very least a bit more realistic and challenging and is therefore quite fun. Extremely frustrating however was one mission where you are tasked to kill a number of enemy snipers in a big open environment, who kill you with ease and are extremely hard to spot. But leaving aside a few exceptions, the game is no too hard.Graphics are an area where this game shines, although the level of detail is not distributed quite equally. The player character, as well as the NPC's, look very good but the game world is left out a bit at times. In spite of that, the lighting and bright colors make the world pleasant to look at.A few more nice things that this game features is an X-ray style vision of your target when a bullet flies through them, showing exactly what damage you did. What was also well done in my opinion was the feeling the city gave me. With idle conversations in German around me and the aforementioned nice visuals in the city it did manage to convey the atmosphere of the war-torn city. What bothers me most about it is that there is nothing special about it, except for the X-ray thing. The gun mechanics and atmosphere are nice, but it is all you get and that is not enough for some people. The story, for instance, is quite boring. The game is set in Berlin in the last few weeks of World War II and you play as an American sniper sent to kill a few high-ranking German scientists as well as some of the Russians that are invading the city at that time. The biggest problem with the story, apart from the fact that nothing truly interesting or imaginative happens, is that it is only brought across by a voice during the pre-mission menu. This is no aspect of the game that is relevant.I would reccomend this game anyway, because of that it can be something nice if it is on sale and you are looking for nothing else besides amusing gunplay.

content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
												Fun - 7 (Some of the less than genuine situations sometimes detract from immersion. And although the hard-fought control issue fixes during early release may have improved controls, they still feel kinda "in the way" sometimes. But still quite fun and satisfying)Replay - 4 (I'm guessing the "scenario" type play of SniperEliteV2 doesn't warrant much replayability. And also 'doubt that its multiplayer does much to improve on this)Sound - 6Visuals - 8Value - 6Worth it? - I think so. I've CERTAINLY played much worse military sim / FPS games.Definitely the cure for that itch to use some bullet-time in a sniper situation. Visuals are nice, but not jaw dropping. Sound is slightly above average with some looping war sounds, things get a little gimmicky feeling while you're out and about. Controls are good in most areas but leave a moderate amount to be desired in a couple areas. Namely sprinting (and even moving while standing) feel forced and ham-fisted. There is little difference between and standing walking and a running sprint, they both feel loud, careless, and half-uncontrollable.It took me three fresh starts to finally find the difficulty settings I wanted. For mil-sim fans, you'll definitely wanna turn up the difficulty settings, or perhaps just do a custom difficulty like I did to turn on some of the more "simulation" style aspects of gunplay. Things still get a little....action-movie'y during play. But, I suppose everyones gotta have a day job. Overall, my expectations were not disappointed much at all and I find it an enjoyable (albeit slightly arcade-y) sniper game.

Onto visuals and general gameplay:It's a decent-looking game, slightly leaning more towards the prettier side, although the character animations are rather rough. Most custscenes of the campaign are unecessary, and the end of every mission (MINOR SPOILERS) is literally just the main character walking out of the scene. (END SPOILERS) Gameplay however is pretty addicting and I'd imagine people who enjoy the first few hours of this game would strive to become better. You don't really have many weapon-choices, however, each weapon offers a number of options for a distinct playstyle of the player's choosing; be it stealth or run and gun.I would recommend this game for the gameplay, but the campaign is on the fine line between simple or barely worked on.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 1, 2014
												A very pleasant surprise, this. When I heard of the original game not scoring too well, I had little hopes for this either. I obtained it through the Free Offer that Steam gave out back in June and literally only installed it just over a week ago.The WW2 back-story is interesting, though far from unique. But rarely have I come across a game that rewards you for playing it 'well'. The game's main character (you) - can easily play though and complete it with all guns blazing. You can also proceed as a sniper should- slowly, methodically and scanning every piece of terrain between you and your target. It's entirely possible to complete a level without ever alerting the enemy - using a mixture of cover, stealth, silenced handguns and above all - patience. Playing in this style will maximise both your points and overall score.Personally, I went for a mixture of the two - taking time when I could and literally firing from the hip when needs must. SE2 isn't without it's faults. For the ease of gameplay, vehicles and armour often have an explosive fuel tank strapped to their flank. I'm pretty sure that no Tiger or T-34 tank was taken out in WW2 through a sniper hitting just the right area of a diesel can on the side! :) Also, and a little frustrating at times, is the dubious hit detection. Many a time I scoped up an enemy and the bullet I fired made a perfect hole in the wall - directly behind their head or hat. By which point, the enemy is alerted to your position and you have to frantically fight back.Those are small gripes however, in and otherwise thoroughly enjoyable and worthwhile game. If you like your FPS games to be a little less gung-ho - or you like to tactically work your way to a defined target - then this game is for you. Oh, and if you thought the bullet-time action was good in the Max Payne games - see what your bullets do to the opposing forces....Good fun and much appreciated - thanks Steam.8/10

content:
Posted: September 25, 2014
												This is a single player review as I don't care for multiplayer games.I really wanted to like this game. It has some unique mechanics that set it apart from many of the other FPS and 3rd person shooters out there and was fun for a bit till I started noticing the many, many, flaws in it, namely that it tires to be too many different things at once... The biggest problem though, is it suffers from the sameness those games do as well. Pushing the player into corridors and hallways way too often and not giving enough options for strategy or planning of any sort. Being a gun enthusiast in the real world I know a bit about bullet drop, wind, and ballistics and it gets things almost right when it comes to the sniping aspects, for the most part (I could nitpick about lack of penetration namely wood is not bulletproof, and their extreme bullet drop at what are considered normal engagement ranges for battle rifles, but with the limited map sizes it is understanable), as for other weapons? Heck no!The problem is that for a game called "Sniper Elite" there is very little opportunity to snipe. Bad guys seem telepathic, levels are way too linear and too many corridor shooter parts, too many close quarters combat parts, not enough options for sniping as you are mostly stuck on the ground for much of the game with very few options for good sniping positions... You can climb over some walls but not others even if they are lower than the walls you can climb over! Too many times I thought, "Oh look if I can just get up to that window it would be a perfect sniping position." Nope invisible un-climbable wall that is only 3 feet high! The few levels where you get a nice open map with lots of options for sniping are quite a bit of fun and the only reason I would recommend to get this game but only for under $5.A big issue I have is with the close quarters combat this game forces on the player way too often... First off, enemies do not spawn until you reach certain trigger points or check points, so in an open area you cleared out, all of a sudden new enemies are swarming you that were not there before, forcing you into yet more close quarters combat because they all telepathically know where you are! There were a few times I thought I had a nice hiding spot and an enemy would actually SPAWN ON TOP OF ME out of thin air! Now that would not be a problem if weapons outside of the sniper rifle could actually hit things you were aiming at, but for some reason an SMG cannot even hit a guy that is 5 feet in front of you! At full auto on the SMGs, bullets seem to leave the barrel at nearly 80degree angles so firing off a full magazine of 30+ rounds you will be lucky if 5 bullets actually hit the enemy 5 feet away. I don't think the people that made this game ever even fired an SMG in the real world because the mechanics of it are absolutely terrible in this game. Some other weird issues, certain enemies’ weapons will vanish when you take them out because the game designers didn't want you to get those weapons too early on, "Oh look he has a Nagant! I want that!" poof vanishes, "Damn."For a game about stealth and sniping it has some serious drawbacks. The stealth is meh. Also location based body damage is very unrealistic. I thought, "Wow! I love the bullet camera, this is pretty neat! Uh oh I see an enemy sniper's hand! I'll shoot him in his hand and take him out of the battle." So I fire over 5 shots into the enemies hands and he just keeps shooting at me like it never touched him. Or if you shoot someone in the leg they just do a cruddy little stumble animation and then continue firing at you like nothing happened even if you technically would have blown off their kneecaps. Even on hard the AI is terrible... Just find a bottleneck area and the enemies will pour through it even if they see a pile of their dead buddies stacked up there. Relocation doesn't work either, I could run away from a group of enemies to try and pick them off and in most cases, even if I ran halfway back across the map, they somehow always know where I am.And the final reason for the thumbs down on this game I tried really hard to like.... It is less than 8 hours long and that is even with me trying to explore every little nook and cranny in the game. It does have some replay value for the few good sniper levels, I will give it that.Bottom line: Sniping is quite a bit of fun in this game, when you are presented with the opportunity to snipe, and the few areas where you can take multiple approaches and the trap setting and strategy can be quite fun when it isn't forcing you down a linear path... But I cannot recommend this game for over $5 because most of the game is close quarters combat with terrible close quarters weapons that cannot hit a thing directly in front of you, the enemy AI is terrible even on hard, for a game about sniping you are more the typical "one man army" type every other shooter game does and sniper rifles feel more like a secondary weapon at that point. If you are going to call a game "Sniper Anything" it needs to have a bigger focus on the whole sniper part.

content:
Posted: October 1, 2014
												A very pleasant surprise, this. When I heard of the original game not scoring too well, I had little hopes for this either. I obtained it through the Free Offer that Steam gave out back in June and literally only installed it just over a week ago.The WW2 back-story is interesting, though far from unique. But rarely have I come across a game that rewards you for playing it 'well'. The game's main character (you) - can easily play though and complete it with all guns blazing. You can also proceed as a sniper should- slowly, methodically and scanning every piece of terrain between you and your target. It's entirely possible to complete a level without ever alerting the enemy - using a mixture of cover, stealth, silenced handguns and above all - patience. Playing in this style will maximise both your points and overall score.Personally, I went for a mixture of the two - taking time when I could and literally firing from the hip when needs must. SE2 isn't without it's faults. For the ease of gameplay, vehicles and armour often have an explosive fuel tank strapped to their flank. I'm pretty sure that no Tiger or T-34 tank was taken out in WW2 through a sniper hitting just the right area of a diesel can on the side! :) Also, and a little frustrating at times, is the dubious hit detection. Many a time I scoped up an enemy and the bullet I fired made a perfect hole in the wall - directly behind their head or hat. By which point, the enemy is alerted to your position and you have to frantically fight back.Those are small gripes however, in and otherwise thoroughly enjoyable and worthwhile game. If you like your FPS games to be a little less gung-ho - or you like to tactically work your way to a defined target - then this game is for you. Oh, and if you thought the bullet-time action was good in the Max Payne games - see what your bullets do to the opposing forces....Good fun and much appreciated - thanks Steam.8/10

												An excellently well done game. If you loved the previous Sniper Elite this is an improved and added upon version. content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												Keep your distance Sniping is always great fun so any game that offers plenty of it has to be a good thing. The sniping in SNIPER ELITE V2 is (as I understand it) pretty realistic. It includes all the conditions that would effect such a task in the real world, including bullet drop, wind speed and direction, body movement etc. There’s no denying the satisfaction when you score a hit, especially a headshot, and this is often augmented by the enjoyable spectacle of the bullet flying through the air in slow-motion towards its target. Personally, I could have lived without the kill-cam’s depiction of the victim’s injuries, but this is only a game so let’s not get too wrapped up in the ethics. Less successful is the close-quarter combat that you are sometimes forced into. The cover-based stealth system is less sophisticated than in some games (Deus Ex: Human Revolution, for example) and aiming at close range can be problematic. This, coupled with a ridiculously keen-eyed AI, can prove frustrating. The graphics are good to very good, with the ruins of a war-torn Berlin particularly well depicted. The story is rather fractured due to the mission-based gameplay but SEV2 isn’t really about story, its about honing your long-range shooting skills, and this it does well.3.5/5

												Finshed the game in about 11 hours. I've always been drawn to sniper rifles in other games so a game that dealt with sniping as the primary combat method was appealing to me. If you're into sneaking around and quietly waiting for the shot, this is the game for you. There are segments with close combat as well and you'll make use of a silenced pistol in some areas. The bullet "cam" is a cool feature and you can adjust the frequency of the kill shot animations. It can get repetitive but I left it at the default setting. I did not encounter and bugs other than some minor path issues. The enemy AI can be smart but there are times when the enemy just walks around even though his comrades are dropping around him. The music does a lot to indicate the danger as well as set the spririt of the time period.  I definitely enoyed the game, the missions and the combat mechanics.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2014
												Sniper Elite V2 is a WW II 3rd person shooter with a linear level design with SP and MP mode.Graphics:     5/10Graphics are ok but the textures appear blurred even with the highest settings. The colors are realistic and suitable. Neither special nor modern.I like the bulletcam. It gives you the right feeling of hitting someone critically.Leveldesign:     4/10Well - I know the scenery is determined by the World War theme but it's extremely monotonous. Always the same destroyed buildings. The levelborders are partly ok since it's not that difficult to design them in a destroyed city.Gameplay/Handling/Equipment:     7/10All in all a standard shooter. It annoys me that the bullet hits a cover I never aimed for because the view is odd sometimes. The snipers work fine for me. I didn't really recognize a major difference between them except for the clipsize and manual or semi-auto. The pistols are kind of useless, but after all the game is named sniper elite.Trapmines are nice but you will rarely use them.AI:     6/10Seeks cover, uses grenades, authentic aiming, reacts when someone gets hit.But sometimes the AI just randomly runs around inviting the sniper to shoot him right between the eyes.Sound:     3/10First the good things: Yes, it sounds like a war. Plenty of bomb explosions from afar, gunshots etc, etc. The weapon sounds are somewhat "ok" but i'm not impressed. The music is very annoying. There are like 2 or 3 tracks and that's it. And on top of that the soundtrack is boring in the first place.Storyline:     1/10I think the problem here is: The developers wanted the story to be kind of realistic. But it is not. Why? Because you are a super-sniper-soldier, killing hundreds and hundreds of Nazis and Russians. And your "awesome" mission is: Kill some strange guys who have something to do with the V2-Rockets. Well. Nice. That shows that the priority was set on the word "Sniper". Because they just needed any random reason to take a gun and shoot people.Critic summary:     4.3/10Personal fun rating:     5/10     [mediocre game]Since I got the game for free I recommend the game to play it at least a few hours.But I would never buy the game for 10 bucks. Not sure if I would for 5.It's strange enough to make the game in third-person-view. I didn't finish the story and I think I never will. There is no reason to play the game twice. If you are a Sniper-enthusiast then go for it. But since I write this review for people who consider to buy it:Don't do it.

content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												I'm approaching this from someone who never plays shooters. I've had a great time playing SE V2 and I'm not much of an action / shooter gamer.  I never play FPS games because they make me motion sick. So I'm really entirely new to the genre. I couldn't play Doom, Unreal, Quake or anything else because I'd be sicker than a dog in 5 minutes. Sniper Elite V2 is probably the first shooter I could...ahem...stomache.So after not puking while playing the demo, I decided to get SE V2 on sale and I was really pleasantly surprised. It's a lot of fun sneaking around, figuring out the best angles, staying hidden, spotting your target and pulling off a brilliant shot. It's one of my better "hmmm, let's take a chance" purchases on Steam.Of course, the sniper rifle isn't the only thing available to you. You have your trusty Thompson machine gun and a silenced pistol. You also have grenades (though very limited amounts), tripwires, mines and even rocks (nothing better to try to get a guard to investigate an area). Each map is laid out like a puzzle and it's up to you to solve it. Do you run and gun? Do you sneak? Do you lure your enemies into a trap-filled area and watch them blow up? With numerous options and difficulty levels, it can be a challenging game the 2nd or 3rd time through.Personally, I'm pretty hardcore. I like the sneaking method. So I take my time, creep into position, take my shot and get the heck out of there before the Germans come running. It's great fun and I feel that there's a sense of accomplishment when I can do that.Are there problems? Yep. Some enemies are scripted to "see" you when they enter the map. Other enemies don't appear on the map until you hit a specific waypoint. These scripted challenges make the game feel artificially difficult and occasionally downright cheap. Truly, the game works best when it lets you play the pure role of the sniper, but some maps and areas are little more than stand-up firefights. SE V2 doesn't do these very well, so these missions or areas become tedious fast. Of course there's also MP, but that's not my thing and the MP community has already moved on to SE3.The other aspects - the story, the "bullet kill cam", the (few) different weapons - didn't really interest me all that much. The graphics are fine but they're certainly not top notch. But since I found great pleasure in spending 20 minutes creeping into just the right position to blow Generic German #142's head clean off, I quite enjoyed it. Enough to play all the way through at least twice. So if the demo appeals to you, go ahead and grab it. YMMV.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
												Sniper Elite V2 is a decent sniper game set in World War II.The campaign features a solid storyline. It is set in 1945 at the close of WWII and you are behind enemy lines trying to stop the launch of the V2 rockets. The campaign packs some fun elements that not only allow you to attack the Germans but also the Russians, which in itself creates an interesting dynamic where alliances do not matter. The game is around six hours long and some missions are obviously more engaging than others. For the most part, the game emphasises freedom in how to engage your objectives and this allows you to go loud or stealth, creating a fun and exciting balance in gameplay. At only six hours in length, the campaign dragged but it did somewhat allow me to invest into the story.The gameplay is good. It is identical to Sniper Elite 1. The freedom in approach to your missions are interesting in creating strategies on how to engage your enemies without alerting the rest. The gameplay incorporates a slow-motion bullet cam that is now a main part of the Sniper Elite series. It happens so often though that it feels like something to help expand the length of the campaign. The enemy AI is above-average. The machine gunners are smart in listening and knowing where to shoot but the enemy snipers are plain stupid. I did not play multiplayer. I played this around the time Sniper Elite III was out.The performence is atrocious. This game does not have much spec requirements and my computer has better specs than the recommnended. I played on low settings with the majority of settings set to off and that was the only chance I could obtain a consistent 60 FPS. Absolutely awful.Pros:- Sniping mechanics.- Freedom in missions.- AI was somewhat challenging.Cons:- Performence.- Length and quality of campaign. At six hours, the campaign dragged in the final two.- Enemy Sniping AI.- A lot of bugs.Overall, Sniper Elite V2 is a decent game. It features a solid campaign that is interesting enough until it drags. It incorporates fun gameplay with some twists into the strategic element, and will keep you entertained for a few hours. I recommend this on sale. 6.5/10Thanks for reading my review! content:

												First off, this is a game about sniping. It tries to be about sneaking, but the mechanics are terribly done and it is all but impossible. First off, guards see you from 100m away while youre crouched or behind boxes or anywhere you are. This negates trying to move quielty and every time a firefight erupts. Also, you cant be quiet because even if you jog or run 200m away or two floors below, they instantly hear you and know where you are and come to you. Also, they don't just move toward noise and turn around or anything, even if you are behind cover they wouldn't walk past you in the room; they walk right up to you as if they knew you were there the whole time. The other big problem is that all the levels are SUPER linear. You can't go in half the buildings and even if you can you can only go up into a window but you can't go through them. If there is a wide open level it still only has 1 little open door/gate to go through and it is guarded by a few guards.

Posted: February 17, 2015
												This game barely improved after the first part. They kept everything almost exactly the same. Once again Berlin, once again small streets with little space.In all honesty, about the only improvements are concluded in some of the presentation of the cutscenes in the beggining, some music, the slow motion camera and the sound design.However all else can be found for a much lower price in Sniper Elite (2005). I'm presuming most people got Sniper Elite V2 in June 2014, but if you're thinking of getting it, then I strongly advise to much rather look upon the predecesor.I was personally rather disappointed with the quality of the character animation, the firefights and the stealth in general. It kept all the clunky aspects of the previous game, with only very slight upgrades - of course the visual side too, but it falls apart when I see the low level the general execution of most levels.  The level design is linear. It feels more linear than even the first gameEven more, I would say most levels seem way too reminiscent of the previous game. They could've went with pretty much any other European setting of WW2, but since they kept Berlin it's way too reminiscent of it. It's just not a good game from what I saw.Perhaps in the future they will work more on it and bring it in order with future games. But thus far it's a lost cause.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2016
												Since I'm very interested in snipers as a special force and world war stuff I thought I give this game a try. The previous reviews suggested that this game should be "the true sniper experience". Well... I can't confirm that. Don't get me wrong, the mechanics for sniper rifles and the ballistic parts are pretty nice. If you play on the hardest game mode you need to know what you are doing to hit the target. Kill animations are cool as well. So the game tries to give you a realistic experience but then you get to the story and the whole level design. Just a few missions in and you'll recognize that this game is just another MURICA F*#$ YEAH game. Basically you are a one man army defeating thousands of Germans und Russians. I don't think I need to mention that snipers aren't used that way but I guess that's just part of the american propaganda bs about WWII. In this game you need to infiltrate secret facilities and sneak around in destroyed cities. For the most part this feels like playing a James Bond like character that also uses a sniper rifle. I think I could live with this kind of stuff if only the sneak parts and close combat wouldn't totally SUCK! Yes you have a silenced gun BUT you can only aim in third person and the crosshair is bigger than your mum’s meat wallet. This of course leads to missed shots and a LOT of frustration, because you alert the enemies and you can basically get out your MP and go on a Rambo like killing spree. Needing to sneak through some sections is a nice idea and it fits the story but your setup for this is so poorly executed and it is so infuriating if the stupid game mechanic of the silenced gun ruins the whole level. Why put such great sniper mechanics in the game and miss out on the other guns? This decision is beyond me.But here comes the best part of the game:You encounter some tanks and you know what? You can kill them. WITH A SNIPER RIFLE. Not only that this is impossible but the way how you kill those tanks is so ridiculous. You shoot on their "fuel tanks". Just listen to me on this one: The part you shoot at on the Tiger H 1 tank is NOT the fuel tank but the exhaust pipe. God damn I can't believe how stupid this is. Of course the Russian T 34 really had some fuel depots on the outside of the tank but they were for reserve and wouldn't explode if you shoot them. You know I have no Problem with fighting a tank in a sniper game, but they could have handled it so much better. Why not use a Molotov like the Russians really did in WWII? No you need to shoot on the tank to make it explode. Like that wouldn't get the attention of the other soldiers. This game tries to be a stealth game but ultimately it aims to throw endless hordes of enemies at you, which is annoying because as a sniper you are not very well equipped for this kind of battle. Go figure. It is disappointing that the producers decided to sacrifice the nice sniping mechanics for the sake of explosions and a lot of PEW PEW.For a game that wants to be a sniper game it focuses not enough on the position snipers had and have in an army. If they would have studied how snipers operate it could have been a really nice game. But even if we stay on the actual game, it has major flaws aside from the sniper parts. So I can't recommend it unleast you don't care much about historical correctness or being an american supersoldier (AGAIN) who reks everything and everyone in big fashion.

content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
												The game has a lot of flaws but is pretty decent nonetheless. They really drive home the point that this is a sniping game by giving you a very small amount of ammo for your tommygun and pistol. It means that 95% or higher of your kills will be by sniping. It makes it frustrating at times because you have to face off against a squad of guys, ten to twenty guys usually, and snipe them all down. It is not hard at all, just that sniping gets old after a while. The bullet cam is one of the cooler ideas that I have ever seen in a game but unless you turn down its frequency in the options then you are going to be seeing it hundreds of times in the game and it gets old real fast. The realism is entirely absent and the game is highly inconsistent. What I mean is that sometimes a bullet through the chest of an enemy will kill him but a lot of times it just does 50% dmg to him and he stands there like nothing happened to him and fires exactly the same as before you shot him. Tanks also have external gas tanks on them that blow the tank up when shot. Gee, if only it were that simple in real war. Enemy snipers also are psychic. They are magically aware of your exact location and pull off pinpoint headshots on you even when you are somewhere that they should have no idea about, even when you have only snuck around a corner into view without making any noise and they are very far away across the map. The AI is also dumb as fk. They stand up out of cover and stand out in the open the entire game, making snipe-killing them a cinch. Snipers are somewhat hidden but when you see where they are they make almost no effort to re-adjust when you fire their way. They just stand and fire in a snipe battle with you until you quickly kill them. Use your tommygun and pistol ammo very, very sparingly, as you get such a small amount and there are usually no places to get any more ammo during a level until the next level starts and you are magically at full ammo again.I tried the MP briefly and I have to say it was fun. And surprisingly it still has enough of a fan base that you will find games to join. It has all the classic game modes too: dm, tdm, and ctf, and several co-op modes.The game has more of a arcade feel to it than an actual sniping game but it is still a pretty decent game that is optimized pretty good and runs smoothly. It can be fun for a once-through, but it is only about as good as the average professional review of the game which was between 60 and 70 out of 100.

content:
Posted: April 3, 2014
												While Sniper Elite v.2 is a unique and interesting game with well-built mechanics and physics, it unsurprisingly has no story.To elaborate, single player is highly enjoyable - by no means is it terrible. It works properly, is immersive, and is captivating. But I did not purchase something I could acquire for free, I had purchased something that would hopefully fulfill my lust for PvP sniping. This did not occur.Rebellion, quite clearly does not care about their community that have put up with their abhorrent DLC useage (You do not HAVE to buy them, but if you want more than a handful of maps, a Walther Gewehr 43, a Springfield M1903A1, a E.W. Maschinenpistole 40, a Thompson M1A1, and a few explosives you are going to HAVE to buy the DLCs.), and various connection issues. A game like this could have easily flourished if proper support was given to the community and if things were different. However, this is not the case - Rebellion's support team after repeated reports of server connection issues demanded it was a local issue, and therefore not their software's fault when in reality, people on the Xbox 360, PC, and PS3 were reporting these issues which are still unaddressed officially and have no proper fix and do not have one in sight with the advent of Sniper Elite V.3 which, I am sure will have the same DLC useage and connection issues but I shall not jump to any preemptive conclusions but Rebellion has made it quite clear with their lack of support for Sniper Elite V2 (Instead of fixing the issues, we had gotten two more cliched, poorly-written games that were so short they may as well have just been DLCs, but I digress.) With any hope, I was wrong about my assumptions of Sniper Elite V.3 but I severely doubt it. The only way Rebellion could possibly find more players to populate their game servers is to correct the lack of a progression system. (While I do not disapprove of DLCs being used to acquire weapons, there SHOULD be a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ progression system that allows you to unlock normal, run-of-the-mill firearms with DLCs offering unique and special firearms.)In short, Sniper Elite V.2 has a strong and enjoyable yet poorly-written single player with an absolutely terrible multiplayer set with connection issues, poor netcoding, and no progression system allowing you to unlock firearms without buying them.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												Finally a game for the people who like to camp on top of a roof  in Battlefield sniping at the enemy while their team gets hammered. Actually this is a really enjoyable game. I had a lot of fun playing this game which was a pleasant surprise since i wasn't expecting it to be great.The sniping in this game is done really well with an excellent slow motion kill cam that shows an x-ray of your bullet tearing through your targets body. I honestly never got tired of the x-ray kill cam even after seeing it so many times. There's a lot of other interesting mechanics with the sniping. For example you can target a grenade on a soldiers belt and make it explode while it's still attached to him or you can wound a target which will cause his comrades to try to help him which gives you the oppurtunity to pick them off as well. You also get things like trip mines and land mines to set traps for soldiers or to kill anyone trying to flank you.What let's the game down is the boring forgettable story line and poor implementation of stealth. It is possible to take a stealthy approach though i found i rarely did preferring to go gun-ho with the rifle which often worked so there was hardly any motivation to try and use stealth. Overall this is a fun shooter thats worth picking up. I haven't tried the multiplayer so just take this recommendation as being on the singleplayer. I'd give this game a 7.5/10

content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												The charm of Sniper Elite V2 is probably based off of it's satisfaction-- that is the satisfaction of getting a long range headshot and-- holy♥♥♥♥♥♥I just blew off his entire top half of his skull!Beyond that gameplay wise it is a stepup from Sniper Elite 1 and that it's more hands on persay-- more hop-into-the-action feeling. My three main complaints with the game is that it is much more linear this time around, giving you less chances to explore and find multiple angles and camp spots-- which is a shame for a game like this. My second complaint is that the AI is still rather dim, as one alerted guard quickly turns everything into a game of "Muzzle Flashing Whack a Mole" but with more Nazis and crushed skulls. This ties in with my third issue and that the stealth in this game that could of been, lacks. Stealth in this game is basically there just to set your starting up area and get whatever position you want before the rest of the enemies are alerted. I don't think it's possible to play the whole game undetected, unless of course you want to stick to the welrod. Due to the issues above, the idea of this being an open world exploritive sniper game kinda dwindles down into a bunch of mad quick-finger killing sprees, which isn't so bad because the game itself is fun.It's not a bad game, it's just a very simplistic one, but nontheless it is quite enjoyable and worth a couple of hours to kill for sure.Then there is the multiplayer...The multiplayer is...surprisingly fun. The constant struggle for keeping your score, that fear and caution you get trying to hunt down the other player (unless there is a bunch, then it becomes a war-party of speed and reflexes) is so enjoyable and at times immersive, It makes the MP in this game worth a mention, because holy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ is it fun. Get friends, snipe eachother in the face, and laugh when you win. Get it on a sale.7/10

This might come as a shock to you, but it's a game about some super elite sniper who has weird slow motion powers or something. But how does this game hold up.Let's start of with the gameplay. How silly of you.The level desing is alright, but nothing to write home about. I wish that the levels were more open, but they do give you some optional paths from time to time. Visually this game is also really average, however the sound desing is pretty decent.The best part about this game is that you can beat it in less than 3 hours. Oh wait, that is absolutely horrible...Even though this game has some massive issues, I don't think that it's a bad game. The co-op does redeem it a little, but not enough. It still ends up being a pretty average experience, with some neat X-ray kills. If that saves it for you then great, but it doesn't quite do it for me

												This game is a lot of fun if you like Sniping. There are close combat and automatic rifle fights too, but it is designed for people to snipe. This is a good thing. The focus is on the gameplay for sniping. The levels are very nice and the graphics are great. The effects of bullet impacts on enemies is gory but amazing to see. The story is interesting enough, but the gameplay is fun enough for the story to not be that important.There is a lot of replayabilty due to its multiplayer co-op and versus. Again, great execution on Sniping gameplay. Be warned this game might not be for you if you rather play a mix of shooting styles. Like I said, it is designed for sniping and it delivers. If you plan to run and shoot everyone with a machine gun you will get frustrated as there is not much ammo for them. Since the developers designed the game to be for sniping. It is easy to get into, but very very hard to master. You can play Arcade like sniping, up to fully realistic with bullet drop, wind and aim. But, the harder the settings the more you enjoy each kill, and the Kill Cam effects are very enjoyable. As the game is a bit older, I would recommend to wait for a 50% sale at least ($30 normal price at review time.)

												A really really enjoyable game if you're into shooters/sniping. It controls fairly well and the aiming on the weapons are an absolute delight, although the graphics seemingly have not aged that well don't let that deter you.The main problem I did have quite a bit of during the game however was the AI, I played on the hardest difficulty for the extra challenge, (No slow motion aim assist, realistic bullet drop and windage, AI can see you from a greater distance and never forget about you even if you hide) which made the game just that much more challenging and fun. content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												Finally a game for the people who like to camp on top of a roof  in Battlefield sniping at the enemy while their team gets hammered. Actually this is a really enjoyable game. I had a lot of fun playing this game which was a pleasant surprise since i wasn't expecting it to be great.The sniping in this game is done really well with an excellent slow motion kill cam that shows an x-ray of your bullet tearing through your targets body. I honestly never got tired of the x-ray kill cam even after seeing it so many times. There's a lot of other interesting mechanics with the sniping. For example you can target a grenade on a soldiers belt and make it explode while it's still attached to him or you can wound a target which will cause his comrades to try to help him which gives you the oppurtunity to pick them off as well. You also get things like trip mines and land mines to set traps for soldiers or to kill anyone trying to flank you.What let's the game down is the boring forgettable story line and poor implementation of stealth. It is possible to take a stealthy approach though i found i rarely did preferring to go gun-ho with the rifle which often worked so there was hardly any motivation to try and use stealth. Overall this is a fun shooter thats worth picking up. I haven't tried the multiplayer so just take this recommendation as being on the singleplayer. I'd give this game a 7.5/10

content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												I haven't paid for this game because i picked this up when it was free for a short time and is still don't want to play it because it's (atleast for me) very boring. I will explain my experience with this game so you can decide if those issues would bother you or not. It certainly doesn't statisfy me.The game plays and feels like a generic third person shooter with minimal story. The main complaints would be the repetitive, casual gameplay that only has hints of depths with the use of some stealth elements which are not really there after you have played for 30 minutes, the very stupid KI which just runs straight at you so you can shoot them one by one (and there are masses of them in many levels i have played). The leveldesign is basically non-existent. There are a few houses you cant enter but other then that everything is static and the Layout represents a straight line from A to B. The few additional ways you can walk despite the main route on every level are mainly there to hide gold(collectibles) which don't feel rewarding when you collect them at all. The controls are unpleasant although i have to give credit to the Dev's that they allow to turn off mouse acceleration (i will never play a game that forces mouse acceleration, it just sucks big time), although it's turned on by default. The bad level design is also reflected by the choice of having automatically generating health and ammo supply that is so great that it feels infinite.The only thing i found to be original and was actually good fun is the "KillCam"-Feature which let's you see in SlowMo how your bullet hits the enemy and breaks organs and bones on the way through. It's very unrealistic of course but very fun and feels great.I can recommend this game to casual/console gamers that don't want to be occupied with games for  longer than 30 minutes at a time. It just lacks diversity and depth in order to be a good game that a pc-gamer who likes original, challenging and motviating gameplay would want to play.Ah another thing iIalmost forgot: This game also has great performance issues on some machines, i haven't bothered that much with fixing those as the game wasn't worth the work but it may be something i should mention.While the Game works fine on my Laptop (i5-4200U,8GBRam,GT750M4GB), it just runs horribly horribly bad on the much more powerful machine of my girlfriend (i5-2500k,GTX570,8GBRam).

content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
												First things first - DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU WANT TO DO LONG RANGE TACTICAL SNIPING.This game, unlike the first, has no such feature. The only time you do any kind of long range is when sniping other snipers, of which there are 3 at most. A lot of the time you are sniping at much closer ranges, and instead of sniping as the games title implies you actually have to use a machine gun or pistol. The pistols are ok, but the machine guns feel very underpowered and it is much better to just shoot your sniper than switch to it - they feel as though added last minute. Next, the sniper. It is severely underpowered, 3 shots to the chest for a kill! This mixed with the underpowered machine guns and pistols with limited ammo and low rates of fire, makes closer combat very difficult. Yes at long ranges it makes sense it doesnt kill the enemy, but at point blank a sniper bullet to the chest should at least wound the soldier a little more. The thing making this more ridiculous is a well timed shot to the soldier is nearly always a one shot kill, occasionally 2 if you dont quite hit the sweet spot.All in all, this game is ok. I got it for free, so I guess I cant complain, but if you are buying and want a tactical sniping game, buy the first one.

content:
Posted: June 12, 2014
												A quite intriguing WWII Shooter from the start, but it falls off heavily in every single aspect after 4-5 levels.The game reduces the Sniper Elite series to a core, removing many action and openly kissing its own shoes with its oppressing and, after the first time of seeing it, very boring and annoying kill-cam mechanic. The Stealth, which was the main emphasis in earlier titles. was also limited down by removing the option to vary in speed and giving the enemies the ominous, omniscient "I SEE THAT FILTHY AMERICAN AROUND THE CORNER"-ability, which kind of destroys the point of having any stealth at all. The combat heavily suffers from unpredictable movement patterns and instakills from most weapons, making the player unkillable within cover. Regenerative health doesn't help that. Even on higher difficulties the experienced (meaning: has played a videogame before) player wont die ever if its not from some cheesy event-trigger that spawns a squad in his face. And yeah, those happen alot.And last but not least, while dealing with a realistic topic, the story feels as cliché-ridden as a late 2000's sitcom, making Russians the main antagonist in a rather insulting plot sourrunding some german-socialist conspiracy while still sticking to the gameplay as the main aspect. IMO a shooter like this has to pick: story-driven or gameplay-focussed. Trying to combine both, at least in this case, worked out to be a sloppy and tiring mess, hardly describable as fun.Also, multiplayer doesn't feel any different as single player, no real cooperation whatsoever. Play something else, maybe an earlier title, and expect improvement in Sniper Elite III. That trailer looks promising to me.4/10

content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												If you can get this game on sale it's fine. But after the first 3 or 4 levels it falls apart. The story telling is dull, told through narrated text between missions, and the few cutscenes there are, are nothing to write home about.The games high points fall somewhere between landing your first trick shot with no assistance in a "realistic" ballistic setting, and sniping long distances or taking out multiple targets.Unfortunately the mechanics drag on while dropping you into a boringly linear level, while making you *THINK* you have some kind of freedom of choice. The kill cams are a great part of the game, but the hype that it rode on fell apart quickly. Too often do you find yourself switiching to a sub-machine gun and wonder how a sniper can't seem to hit a target accurately 20 feet away with it, while you're being ripped to shreds by infantry across the map.It also tries to teeter on the fence between "Lone gunman" and "espionage" without ever really accomplishing either. The cover is clunky and poorly executed, making sneaking feel like a clutzy, epileptic nightmare. Meanwhile soldiers are either completely blind or have super-human vision, sometimes seeing through objects, and at incredible distances, but never seem to see movement in there peripheral vision. Thrown objects are a nightmare akin to that of Uncharted (the first). Throwing from cover is a dangerous gamble and can end up killing you, because clearly the sniper was not a baseball player.This game does a few things good; the sniping can be fun and rewarding, and the kill cams can be cringe-worthy.But the poor controls for sneaking, throwing anything (grenades, and rocks) coupled with a bland story, hiccups in gameplay. shoddy AI, and collectible-collecting that feels tacked on ultimately rob this game the kill-shot it could have been.TL:DR - If the game is on sale and you're looking for a few hours of entertainment, without taking anything too seriously, this game is a decent buy, but don't expect it to be the golden-goose of entertainment in your steam library.
